Reviews.Title: “Great birthday venue”
Reviews.Author: Eric_Boc
Reviews.Content: I had my wife's 30th birthday here and it was a hit. If wasn't cheap, but if you are willing to pay up you can get a big room that can hold about 20 people. The bed was great too. I would recommend holding a party here. The view from the club is also great but very loud on a Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: cnsp0ts2
Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else. Spent a pretty penny to stay here and they wouldn't even let us up to the roof top bar. There are much better hotels in new York. We stayed in New York for 2 days and at 2 different hotels. This one was the worst ever. Dont waste your money!!!! You can find a much better deal some place else. The rooms are way too small and you can hear every noise in the hallway. Nothing like listening to slamming doors all night. Seriously. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Friendly...”
Reviews.Author: Chris K
Reviews.Content: are the two best words I can use to describe The Dream's midtown location. I like the ambience of the rooms with the glowing blue lights. The staff in both the hotel and lounges are very personable and go out of their way to find out a little something more about each of their guests. The only drawback is one that can't be control -- street noise -- and that only applies to the rooms at the front of the building and only on the bottom two floors...otherwise, dreams came quickly at the Dream

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MartyDallas
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Dream and was very impressed. The staff was courteous, the room was very clean, and I loved the location. I had a conference at the NY Athletic Club on 58th & 7th so the walk was just 3 short blocks up from Dream. I had meetings in the upper east side, upper west side, times square, and in lower midtown, and because of the great location I was able to walk everywhere. It's the first time I have been to NY without ever having to take a cab. The weather was perfect and the hotel's location to Central Park was very convenient. The price was great, the room was clean and confortable, and I would definitely stay at Dream again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but over top charges”
Reviews.Author: ChefMairaIsabel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dream 2 nights for a business meeting. Rooms are big, specially for NYC. Staff has and attitude. Not sure why, maybe its a NYC thing. Location is great, just a few blocks away from Times Square, but not right on Times Square. Which is great as its not noisy. Incidentals can get very costly. We asked for a bottle of water, got charged $5.00 just to take it up to the room and then of course, tip and tax , which made it for a very expensive little bottle of good old H2O. $14 is a lot for water - I think-. Also, we asked for a taxi to go to the airport, and the bellman said, they had a "car" right outside that will be the same rate as for the taxi. It was NOT! Total cost was more than 25% than the taxi.... In general its a good place, but I will not stay there again next time Im in NYC

Reviews.Title: “One of the best choice in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Denis J
Reviews.Content: Perfection location close to central Park, Time sguare and the Pier for Cruise departure or return. Small room, large bathroom, very clean and helpful staff. The main dining room, Serafina is excellent for breakfast, lunch and dinner; Very satisfied with the overal service and it Will be my first choice for my Next stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suziebc
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Front staff were great - Anthony is very friendly and very helpful. Able to check in early and we got a great room on the 6th floor. Our room was nice and big and it faced Broadway - across from the construction of the new hotel. Didn't bother us at all. Usual Big City noise but we had a great sleep. Great location - close to Subway station and lots of taxis avaliable. Lots of dining/drinks around. Bed and bathrobe very comfy. Great TV. Easy to use safe in room. Negative: Dirty bathroom in the restaurant. Wi Fi is $10 per day if you use it in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel not DREAM Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FabulousfabGeneva
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel experience ever! The entire staff is very rude, front office, room service, instant service, concierge, doorman's... The entire hotel, lobby and elevators were very dirty. The room was even worse, stains on sheets, hair everywhere, broken minibar, safe-box not working... 72 hours for dry cleaning (same day was promised). Don't even think about asking anything to the concierge, they are occupied joking and playing on their phones. Also, If you want to take the elevators after 5pm, count at least 10-13 min waiting time as the doorman keeps one empty for Ava rooftop lounge, even if dozens of hotel guests wait in the lobby... Garbage bags and trash were often all over the hallways in the floors... Also, the fitness room is actually just 3 machines. 2 bikes, 1 runner. One of these wannabe "design-boutique" hotels that cant keep the standard up. A large aquarium in the lobby is the only good part about it. Fortunately I had a good rate...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SecretbeautyCo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the location in NY, rooms are very small but nicely designed and comfortable. Service could be better.

Reviews.Title: “You Have Nothing to Fear But Fear Itself”
Reviews.Author: Little-Tupper
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I had some trepidation about staying at Dream based on some of the nightmarish reviews that I read that were mixed in with some pretty good observations by others. I decided to give it a try because of the great rate they offered on short notice. In a nutshell: -The staff was friendly and efficient. - My room on the 10th floor was ready immediately. -The elevator whisked me to my floor. The room was reasonable in size for a Manhattan boutique. -The room was immaculate and reasonably appointed. - I brought earplugs just in case because of some of the comments about high levels of noise coming from the club in the penthouse. I never needed to use them despite the fact that the hotel seemed pretty busy with people in a celebratory mood. I don't know that I would bring children here but if you are a couple or traveling alone on business or for pleasure it's a good mid-range boutique in which to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable rate at a very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tamer E
Reviews.Content: I booked ahead on priceline and got a pay in advance rate of $104! I have paid up to $400 for much worse hotel rooms in NYC even at $200 this hotel is still definitely a great deal. DREAM is modern and lively right off Broadway. Rooms have unusual blue lighting, but I like blue. Pretty convenient central location. Amazingly beautiful fish tank in the lobby. Supper fluffy comfy beds. I like it!

Reviews.Title: “Really is a dream”
Reviews.Author: EmilyM2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, efficent staff comfy beds & a large room by New York standards!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Uge27
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, moderately priced and greatly located steps away from Columbus Circle and Central Park. The staff is busy but helpful. Can be crowdy, especially at night but the staff is ready to help. The concierge was very patient and helpful especially when the internet had its problems.

Reviews.Title: “Unique spot for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Cassandra S
Reviews.Content: Dream has such a unique atmosphere with the dark blue mood lighting, it's almost like entering a dream world. Is that too corny? :) This is a great hotel for business travellers who are looking for something slightly different from the stereotypical Hilton or Mariott experience. The beds are incredibly comfortable -- like sleeping on a cloud! Of course the rooms are very small (it IS New York after all) and the elevators can be painfully slow at times, but the atmosphere and great location certainly make up for all of that. Just a short walk to Times Square for great nightlife and Broadway shows. The ONLY negative thing about this particular trip was that there is massive construction happening across the street on Broadway, which lasted until 11:00pm and started at 6:00am. It was extremely noisy, but of course there is nothing to be done about that. This construction site is set to complete in 2014, so ask for a room that doesn't face out on Broadway if possible. I've stayed here many times, and will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with great rooftop-bar”
Reviews.Author: fischege
Reviews.Content: The locaton of the hotel is excellent! Cental Park, Carnegie Hall, Rockefeller Center, Broadway and Time-Square are within walking distance! The staff of the hotel was very kind at check in! The Rooms are small but clean! I recommend the rooms facing the the courtyard becouse they are more quiet than those facing the Broadway! The restaurant "Serafina" serves excellent italian cuisine! From the rooftop-bar "AVA-Lounge" you have an amazing view over the Broadway and the Time-Square.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable sized room, unique look and feel”
Reviews.Author: samwSp
Reviews.Content: We found a very cheap rate at this hotel, and we're happy to try it out. From the moment you see the reception to the clever blue lights in the room (that are very clever if you wake up at night and need to move around withou being blinded by the bright white) you will feel this is not a chain; and be happy about it. My only complaint was that the concierge was off duty a little too early to be helpful with dinner reservations, but the check-in staff helped out well. The location is excellent for Times Square, and good for the AMNH and the Metropolitan, as well as the Intrepid. Downtown and SoHo are a bit of a drive, but manageable.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Dream...”
Reviews.Author: janieb50
Reviews.Content: In New York City for business frequently,I was looking for a hotel that would be well located, close to my office, family and friends. The DREAM was just perfect. My room was clean, well-organized, quiet and comfortable.' Mike' at the desk was terrific and 'Susan' from the marketing team took great care to grant me my wishes! I can't wait to return! A Nice DREAM!

Reviews.Title: “Weird Vibe”
Reviews.Author: fauxnerd
Reviews.Content: Good location. Squishy beds. Concierge M.I.A. Weird Vibe. Always met family in town at their hotel, not at this hotel. No WiFi in lobby. People at the front desk were fine. I got the feeling that this hotel was a place to bring your lover, but not family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “it was a dream :)”
Reviews.Author: smyk
Reviews.Content: The decor of the place was just what I expected. Dimmed light, comfy soft beds… But the rooms weren't anything out of the ordinary when you pay over $200 a night. The thing that was amazing was the service. Every single person knew exactly how to make my stay really enjoyable. The rooftop bar was also pretty nice, the view was better than the drinks, but because of the staff my stay was really fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Dream Location”
Reviews.Author: seg1962
Reviews.Content: This may not be the grandest hotel but the location could not have been better. Ideal for Times Square, Broadway, the subway etc. The fact that we were in the thick of all the action in Times Square until very late at night and were then able to walk back was great. The rooftop bar is a bonus as is the attached restaurant on the corner. Rooms are a little on the small side, but who goes to New York to sit in a hotel room all day?! Everything was clean, comfortable and noise free at all the right times. Very relaxing and the staff were efficient and pleasant. Get the hotel car to take you to the airport for just a slightly higher cost than a yellow cab.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ambiance”
Reviews.Author: TERESLILLIAN
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location on 55th street. - Nice ambiance - dreamlike. They have a huge fishtank that extends to the top floor through the center of the hotel. Best part is the yoga/meditation rooms associated with Deepak Chopra. Prices for single rooms were very reasonable when they first opened up. Average room now during the week around $300. Service was mediocre though. If location matters and room size not a concern, I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “dream hotel ny”
Reviews.Author: webone
Reviews.Content: we booked thru book it.com, and got a rate for the area. nice hotel clean and near times square, and central park. the room was small, but we didnt hang around much. people complain about trash being picked up at night, come on be real its new york, when else is it gonna be picked up. my wifes only complaint no prices for the mini bar. also very cool blue lights.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel adn fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: bohoweddings
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay in New York and the hotel made it even better. the modern styling of the rooms was fabulous, the blue lighting really made it. the Location is perfect right in the middle of everything. The roof top bar is amazing and the nightclub later on in the evening even better, and breakfast downstairs in the restuarant was just gorgeous. A great price for a great hotal.

Reviews.Title: “Location great but...”
Reviews.Author: Nomad1966A
Reviews.Content: The location was great, especially over New Year. The staff were super friendly. I admire their attitude, considering the hotel was a great disappointment (for the price). The little minibar in the room was well stocked. The cleaning team was prompt and did a really great job. I worked in the hotel and restaurant industry for a few years, and there are certain things that are just not acceptable especially in a that particular location where one expects a bit more especially at the price they charge. There are smells in the corridors and rooms. It gave the impression of an old hotel that saw too many parties and people. Surely they can use cleaning products that can just make the place smell a bit nicer? I hope the housekeeper puts some pressure on management about this. Secondly, when people write the rooms are small they are actually diplomatic. I have not experienced such small spaces anywhere. Combined with that, the furniture and fittings were very cheap and nasty. We had no space for our shoes or clothes (which we literally had to keep in the suitcase or on the floor... tripping over it is not fun. Possibility there can be some practical solutions to make storage a bit easier. Thirdly - there is no business centre, irrespective of the advert. The business centre consists of a computer in the concierge desk, where you will sit in public and try and do your critical business emails - while other guests think you are an employee there. Another tip to the owners - it would be really useful to have free wireless in the rooms. Who charges rates per device in a room in the time of tablets and smartphones?

Reviews.Title: “Paying for the location”
Reviews.Author: Chelseafc4life
Reviews.Content: Arrived in an always busy NYC and could not wait to shower and rest before tackling the city at night. The Dream's bed was awesome. Comfy and really cosy. We loved it. It was by far the best hotel bed ever. Later that night we had to ask for another room at round 3am. The noise below our window was incredible. Rubbish bins, police and ambulance cars we could cope with, out of control loaded up peeps we couldn't. The noise these geezers were making really drove us crazy. Arrangements were made then and there to move to another room and boy we were so happy we did. This room was quiet and just as cosy and comfortable. We stayed at the dream over 8 nights. Our last night was new years eve. Location was fantastic. Meant that we did not have to camp out Times Square to catch a glimpse of the festivities. The lowlight of our stay was getting stuck in the lift for 15 min....now that was a terrible experience. Problem was the drinking crowds that made their way into an already cramped lift....not a good idea. We would recommend the hotel but be prepared to pay a premium due to location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: NewlywedsBeirut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dream on 55th for 3 nights between Christmas and New Year 2011. We were sceptical because the price we paid online was quite low for a very centrally located and 4 star rated NY hotel. We were not disappointed. The location is amazing. The hotel is clean and neat for a central location. Upon check in, we were upgraded to a King room, which was a good size. Bathroom was decent, clean and comfortable. We have stayed in other similarly rated but more expensive NY hotels where you could not close the bathroom door once inside they were so small, so this was great. I would not say it is a luxury hotel, but perfectly good stay for a central location and we were able to walk everywhere from here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Any Event or Occasion!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal H
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the hotel. Entering the lobby for the first time, we couldn't help but to be overwhelmed by its understated elegance. Although the room was small, it was nicely appointed, very quiet, and very comfortable. The restaurant was accessible from the hotel lobby, and the menu diverse and the food excellent. The hotel was close to shows and Central Park. The staff was helpful and friendly. I'll recommend the hotel to our friends without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Maylo-de
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, very close of subway, café, restaurants, stores, central parc, Time square....

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Gnorm11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first time after having many visits to the more well known hotels in NYC.We were very pleased and pleasantly surprised with the service cleanliness and the convenient location of this establishment. The room was very comfortable and clean, the staff was a pleasure to deal with from check in to check out. This establishment has an excellent reataurant named Serafina, a great Rooftop Lounge, with reasonable rates for everything from dinner to room rates. We look forward to returning

Reviews.Title: “What's the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: JNKetting
Reviews.Content: It is an ok hotel if you can get a good deal on the price. It is promoted as some trendy, high end, design hotel but, although it may have been like that 8 or 10 years ago, I really do not see what the big deal is today. The big plus though is the location. A morning run in Central Park is just 5 minutes away. Apart from that I would say the hotel is between average and good. But again, only if you get a good price and when you don't expect a great hotel. It's a good place if you plan to be out in town most of the time and just use it for a well located place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “In the City that Never Sleeps this was the best nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: EimearT
Reviews.Content: Apparantly this hotel is designed so you have a good night’s rest, from the blue lighting, to the most unbelievable comfy mattresses. (I stay in hotels quite alot for work and this was by far the most comfy bed). For living the Manhatten dream on a girly hol, this hotel had everything, proximity to Central Park, Times Sq, Subway etc. Most of the all the roof top bar was the cherry on the top, with great views of the city, and pretty decent cocktails. I had read a lot of reviews about the small size of the rooms, so that concerned me a bit, and although they aren't massive, you are in the centre of NY so I think they were very acceptable, decent closet space to store suitcases, especially as we were in a standard size room. Overall, this hotel offers a nice boutique experience in an original style NY building, as opposed to staying in a big brand name hotel and really made the trip a bit more authentic

Reviews.Title: “blissful”
Reviews.Author: Cami K
Reviews.Content: I love the Dream Hotel. The costomer service is excellent and the location is so convenient for me when I am in NY. The lobby is so beautiful and I love the contemporaryness of the rooms. Although the bigger rooms for one person make a long stay nice I don't even mind the smaller ones when I am only in for a night or two. I love all 3 bars that it is connected to. I can work all day and there is a place to either dine quietly or party hard!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Racefan24
Reviews.Content: The staff, at the desk, was friendly and helpful. Our room wasn't ready, but they held our bags, so we were happy. The room was small, but nice; bed and pillows were very comfortable. Our 1st night, we only received 1 orange (not chocolate) on our pillows. (They "turn down" the bed; a nice touch.) When we inquired "why only 1 orange?"...the 2nd night, we recieved 2. Dream is conviently located. Asked for a late checkout (Super Shuttle was picking us up @ 1:15) - no problem. The front desk re-keyed our cards and we were able to stay until 1. Great hotel, in a great location; would definitely stay here, again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Service and facilities could use some work.”
Reviews.Author: snh01
Reviews.Content: The good: location! Close to everything I needed and wanted to do and to subway. Room layout was good for a NYC hotel. I got the King room. Very small, but design and layout was practical and appealing. Exception was no full length mirror except inside closet door. The door did not open so that you could actually see yourself. Lost opportunity on not making the over-the-desk mirror taller so you could see yourself when standing. Stayed there because rate was better than most in location. The not so good:maintenence and service issues. 2 light bulbs and sink drain control were not working at check-in. Fixed promptly, but took 2 trips. Was not offered or given newspapers or turndown service despite being Wyndham Rewards member. This seemed to be just a random occurance. A colleague received both without asking. Charged $10/day for VERY slow internet service. Room service errors resulted in cold coffee and toast waiting for a return trip for 2nd person set-up (they were told twice that we had 2 diners when order placed). Work-out room is gloomy, hot, poorly designed and equipped and water cooler was empty. Apparently you can get a pass to a nearby Golds Gym and if you have time and want a real workout, that would be a must. Regardless, it was not OK.

Reviews.Title: “elegant well furnished cells”
Reviews.Author: hagin
Reviews.Content: We got in form an early flight, at 7am, the desk were friendly explained that rooms were not available, signed me in to hotel 1018 and while i was there spoke with house keeping and informed the room will be available in a couple to 3 hours and took my mobile number. Until that moment service was great and friendly, but that was the end of it. never called until we came back at 2pm. then got a different room, we reserved a room for 2, the room we got was small but acceptable for one person, in fact there was one night stand and one night lamp on one side of the bed. moreover when they turned up the beds they only placed an orange on that same side, which to us was a clear message, this is a room for single use. when we inquired they offered to "upgrade to a queen bed for 30 4 a night ( on a 320 a night already paid) We asked for a shower cap and never got it and when asked to to check out 30 minutes late got the full explanation that we only paid until 12pm and it was impossible. In summary, furnishing and linen TOP quality, room size just not acceptable. No room to even place a suitcase on the floor, have to lift on bed every time u need access. will not recommend and will not stay there again. very difficult to sleep in 2 on a narrow double bed.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique on Business”
Reviews.Author: kmichael30
Reviews.Content: Rooms were quite small, but very clean and modern, and a solid price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Botique Hotel in Theatre District”
Reviews.Author: fshea
Reviews.Content: The Dream Hotel is located in the heart of the Theatre District. It is in close proximity to transportation (trains/buses), excellent restaurants, museums and the midtown business district. The Hotel has an on site restaurant clled Serafina which provides very good food at reasonable prices. The check in was friendly, efficient and quick. The staff at the front desk go out of their way to make you feel welcome and accomodate specific requests. My room was exceptionally clean with a relaxing decor. The mattress was the most comfortable I have ever slept on (I actually got the brand name) and I had 2 great nights of sleet. Don't miss the rooftop bar for great views and people watching. I have stayed at the large chain hotels in this area and in the future my choice will be the Dream Hotel. My thanks to the staff. Frank Shea

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small even by New York Standards”
Reviews.Author: kimbo81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a business trip. This is one of our preferred hotels and the first time I have stayed here. I arrived late and was grateful to be told I had been upgraded. Whilst the room was a lot a bigger, the bathroom was still small with little room to unload my tolietries. I finally got into bed at about 12:30am and realised I was right underneath the buzzing rooftop bar, had I have been on holiday I would have headed straight up there but since I had work at 8am the next day, the banging beats and bass was not appreciated (note to self take the upgraded room as long as it is not on the 13th floor) On the upside it was clean, the staff were friendly, the WIFI was strong, the location was great and the rooftop bar is supposed to be amazing. I also loved the quirky decor although I did find it a bit dark (I am getting old) On the downside the rooms are small and especially the bathroom, the 13th floor is very noisey and the room was on the pricey side.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to yell about”
Reviews.Author: Pappitas
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, great location but beds were uncomfortable. Would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A nice dream!”
Reviews.Author: OllieOreo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a couple of Dream hotels and I think they are pretty good value hotels. Dream is about design and comfortable beds! The Dream is located a couple of blocks from times square. When you first enter the Dream hotel you are met by a futuristic looking lobby. Rooms are pretty small even for NYC but that dosnt necessary bother me... The best part about the room is the bed! Super comfortable beds! The concept of the hotel is to enhance your sleep quality... and the beds certainly does the trick, also they have some blue light under the bed which should help you sleep in some way... I liked it... They have a italian restaurant in the building which is also the provider of room service. We ordered in one night and it wasnt good at all and very expensive for what you got... If you get a good deal on the roomthis hotel can be a very good deal! Highlight of the hotel was the soft beds! They also have a kind of hip bar on the top floor which is decent with an ok crowd, but the thing is that the clients of the bar use the same lifts as the hotel guests and there are only 2 (i think) which can create a line for using the lifts which is pretty annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Dream Hotel only good in your Dreams...”
Reviews.Author: jill s
Reviews.Content: My husband and two kids stayed there this weekend for one night. The first thing is that you have to park next door for 25.00 or let them park you next door for 45.00. We walked in and it was pretty nice. We were taken to our room on the 4th floor which was SO SMALL and VERY DUSTY. We called and the manager Angela (very nice) and she put us in a bigger room on the 13th floor but let us know it could get loud as its right below the club. We excitedly went to the 13th floor, when we got off the elevator the whole floor smelled of marijuana! My kids were asking "What is that Smell??"The room was much larger, nicer and even had a balcony. My son went to take a shower, NO HOT WATER and horrible water pressure. The engineer came in and kinda fixed it and said its an old building. My son quickly showered!! Off to dinner we went and came home @ 11:30 VERY TIRED. It was SO LOUD the room was vibrating!! They did move us back to the 4th floor where we just slept. We have ben to many hotels and felt like it certainly wasn't a 4 Star Hotel as they claim. Its very loud @ night with a major club on the main level and another on the 14th floor. I'd say for 500.00 it really isnt worth it @ all. Thinking of writing them a letter just to express my thoughts. We would NOT stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very hip and high energy”
Reviews.Author: TravelDelaware
Reviews.Content: Very cool and chic atmosphere. Be prepared for the nightlife...it's crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Great little find”
Reviews.Author: ALandVIPPY
Reviews.Content: What a cracking little find this place turned out to be. I actually found it on booking.com 6 days before traveling for around $1k for 5 nights, which, given the location didn't think was too bad at all. Due to the massive snowstorm on the Saturday night over NYC, myself and my girlfriend were very late arriving in from Europe and I feared my room might be released as happens quite frequently with some hotels. A quick call to the hotel whilst being diverted to a different airport put paid to any fears. The receptionist found my booking straight away, was very polite and relaxed about the whole thing. She was still on duty 6hrs later when we arrived, remembered the conversation and was so nice to us both. Very efficient speedy service and no more than 6/7mins we were in the room unpacking. Hotel Some would regard this place as a "boutique" hotel, and I would be inclined to agree. Hilton, Marriott, Intercontinental this aint. If that's what you want, then you're looking at the wrong place. Service/Staff Absolutely faultless; very quick; very attentive; no pretensions; no fuss. Location Absolutely perfect if you're ambulatory. 30secs to Broadway; 5mins walk south to Times Square; 5mins north to Central Park; 5 good restaurants, the furthest being no more than 10mins and 3 blocks away; 20secs to a subway station to the Business District. Room I chose a "King Room" and the room faced onto the back of other buildings. My initial thought was "oh damn, no view", but that changed quickly to "Ah, at least no traffic noise". The rooms are on the small side, but that's about par for the course for Manhattan and if you want more, then be prepared to dig deeper into the pocket. The only downside of the room was that for the size, a King-size bed, was just a little too big for the room and it felt a little cramped and the bathroom was pretty small. But, if you've come to do the sights and the shopping, do you really want a gigantic room? However, the plus side is the bed was bang on. I spend 45/50% of my working time traveling and in hotels and I can say for sure it was THE comfiest beds I've ever had in a hotel...by a long way. Cleanliness Housekeeping were very quick and surprisingly for the hotel industry, very quiet. Everywhere I saw in the hotel was spotlessly clean. Would I go back? Yes, without doubt I'd go back. My only gripe - No free Wifi. Come on, in this day and age, it's not too much to ask for free Wifi in a hotel room is it?

Reviews.Title: “Typical NYC Sized Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickyness
Reviews.Content: My gal pal and I took a girls' trip into the city and redeemed her United Miles for a stay at the Dream Hotel. The location is convenient to the subway lines and Times Square/Theater District. The trip started off delayed because the Dream Hotel screwed up the reservation by booking us for the same dates in DECEMBER. The confirmation through United showed October but the idiots that run this place put it into their computer for December and proceeded to tell us that they couldn't do anything about it. We finally got United to straighten this out and we lost a day of NY because of their incompetency. Check in was a pain as the staff was aloof and pretentious. They gave us a room on the first floor and I requested to be on a floor that wasn't so noisy. She then told us that it would be a wait and that housecleaning needs to verify that the room has been cleaned. We were checking in at 4PM and I highly doubt that the ONLY EMPTY ROOM that wasn't on the first floor needed to be verified. After 10 minutes of waiting I blew my fuse. After the hell they put us through the previous day on not having our reservation and then making us wait; I had some words with my friend stating that I had a hard time believing that EVERY ROOM had already been checked into given that it was only 415PM. Miraculously a different room on the 6th floor immediately became available. Room was clean, but small. Staff was useless and pretentious. Given the 5 star service I got at the W Hotel a few months prior, this place is pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “A Hip Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: KateH2010
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel about 1p.m. to drop our bags off before our meeting. The receptionist was very helpful and managed to get us an early check-in. As we had made the reservation through Magellan Vacations we also received a complimentary room upgrade. The room was very modern and the decor very hip. The bed was very comfortable and that is one of my biggest tests of a hotel. Some people have commented that the bathrooms at the Dream are small. Compared to Hotel Roger William they are generously proportioned. My only complaints are I couldn't get a hot shower in the morning. (It was 6:00 a.m. so I don't think they could have run out of water) and there was no iron and ironing board in the room. My colleague who had an adjacent room was able to get a hot shower however another guest checking out was also complaining he couldn't get a hot shower. Hence it may have just been bad luck rather than a major problem throughout the hotel. When I requested an iron housekeeping did bring up an iron and an ironing board. However I do feel this should be included as a standard item in every room. As this was a quick trip packed with meetings I didn't get the opportunity to eat at the hotel restaurant or bar. The doormen went out of their way to hale taxis for us. In some cases it meant they ran a block away to retrieve taxis for the hotel. The hotel opened in June and at checkout they indicated they are still working through a few start-up issues. I would like to go back and stay for pleasure next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dream-Not so much!”
Reviews.Author: MJB93924
Reviews.Content: Great staff, good location, but really dated and DIRTY interiors. This hotel was probably a knockout when it was fresh and new but that was many moons ago. This hotel is TIRED and in desperate need of refreshing. In spite of the above, I would still consider a revisit because the staff was so good, the bed was comfy -but please clean it up. If in this economy a complete redo is not in the cards, how about a steam cleaning and some new grout and some touch up on the baseboards? ? ?

Reviews.Title: “Dream? More like NIGHTMARE!”
Reviews.Author: 720degrees
Reviews.Content: Thump, thump, thump. I could barely get the heavy wooden door open in the gusty New York autumn night. The doormen were all MIA. The barely pubescent girl who greets me at the check-in counter has a voice to match her nimble frame. The lively NY cocktail scene is drowning out her and my words so I am screaming to get her to speak up. The hotel is brand-spanking new and is not displeasing to the eye, but it already has a good deal of scuffing on the pretty wallpaper (who puts up wallpaper in a hallway without adding protective screens?), I got to my room and the interior was as if made out of leftover Barbarella materials. Chain mail, metallic linen and wallpaper surfaces with a hint of Purple Rain lighting didn't exactly scream luxury, but hey, everybody's tastes is different. It looked like the workmen had been scrambling to get the job done on time, because the finishings were not so perfect. Scuffs, broken tiles and crooked joints. Another nifty design feature is the cupboard with the porthole that has a bright light inside it that is impossible to turn off. In an attempt to switch it off, I inadvertently woke up my husband with the main lights going on and off. The solution to the problem? Yank out the cord. If you are out to party and not actually there to sleep, it may very well be a lovely place to hang out. In my case, I was there to sleep, so my experience was rather disappointing. At midnight, I called down to the reception as our bed was vibrating (and not in a good way). The gentleman at the front desk quipped "what can i help you with SIR?". I can appreciate his manners, but no one has never told me my voice sounds like a man's. I complained about the noise, and remarked that I was indeed, a WOMAN. His excuse was that I had come up as Mr. on his screen. Are people so used to trust whatever is on a screen in front of them that they forget they have ears?!?. In response to the noise complaint, he told me he would tell the DJ to lower the base. One our later, the base was still on at full strength and we called down again. This time, we were offered a new room. After getting up in the middle of the night, we were moved to a different room. When asked if anyone else on floor 11 had complained, our escort told me he did nothing but move people from that floor all night and that 1106 was DIRECTLY BELOW the DJ booth. We were moved to a room on the 8th floor which was if possible, even smaller than our last. The slanting walls with the straight curtains did nothing to help that impression but we were too tired to care at that point. Upon checking out, we told the receptionist about what had happened and asked for a discount. He told us there wasn't much he could do but give us a discount towards our next stay. As we are never going to stay at that hotel again, my husband told him in an authoritative voice to do something about the price, which after a while, he did. 150$ rebate for a lost night of sleep. Was it worth it? - Absolutely not.

Reviews.Title: “Night Shift Manager”
Reviews.Author: Laurence T
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected by a loved one, and I would have to say that with Thanksgiving and Halloween around the corner; Kizzy made my stay a very memorable and pleasant one. My room was fine, but the phone system had a few glitches, but she was VERY attentive, thank you Kizzy and thank you Dream!! In the near future, I would definitely keep her in mind for advanced senior career progressions. So, Dream midtown and Dream downtown, Kizzy is your girl! Thank you guys ! Deepak Rajput. C/o Laurence Tucci.

Reviews.Title: “Better to be found in NYC”
Reviews.Author: agjeaton
Reviews.Content: Being a big fan of boutique hotels I decided to give the Dream a run for it's money on a recent business trip to NYC. The hotel has a great location, just off Broadway and very close to the subway station. On check in the staff looked put out having to great me and check me in, I must have disturbed their conversation  on what they had for lunch.  I was not asked for preference on a preferred floor and was accommodated on the 3rd floor, if you have trouble sleeping ask for a high floor as noise outside can be quite load and it was, especially during the weekend. The rooms are tiny, we all expect small rooms in NYC but not this small. They also looked old, slightly grubby and lacked attention to detail one would expect from a Boutique.  One big plus is the quality of the bed, it was extremely comfortable and I would rate it as one of the best I have had in any hotel. The F & B is outsourced and both bars in the hotel are well run, the staff are extremely friendly and go out their way to make you comfortable. I requested a late check out, the receptionist looked at me as if I was asking for a weeks free stay, after deliberating she gave me an hour extra. To wrap it up there is better for your $ in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: sands13wing
Reviews.Content: The pros: the staff was so helpful and friendly, A+; room was very clean, comfortable; amazing fishtank in the lobby and an interestingly decorated sitting area; great location for midtown sights. Cons: Room was small for the price, and a bit noisy because of the traffic outside; no free wi-fi. If my friends hadn't gotten a deal, I doubt I would stay again because of the pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Room was beautiful but noisy”
Reviews.Author: LSharrott
Reviews.Content: We were supposedly upgraded to junior suite. When we got into the room we were so happy. We had a balcony that looked over Broadway and down to Times Square. We were told that the room had a bar over it and were expecting some noise. 10pm rolls around and BOOM - this was not just a bar but a bar with a LOUD DJ that played till 4am. I felt like I was attempting (and I say attempting because there was no way to sleep for me) to sleep in a night club. There was a stairway next door to the room that people went in and out of all night long. I am ambivalent as to whether I liked it or not because the decor and the room was great but the noise stunk. I made notifications to the Manager who was very nice. She did make restitution for the inconvenience with no argument. I would try it again, but would have to make certain I was away from the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and FRIENDLY staff”
Reviews.Author: FilipBeelprez
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in Dream Hotel, 55th street during fashion week. We had a Deluxe double room on the 4th floor. We paied about 300 eur/n Great room with 2 bathrooms and separate living room. Very close to Central Park, Times Square and 5th av. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I don't understand some of the bad reviews about this hotel. It is true to say that the hotel had it's best times and in the morning (4 am) you have a lot of noise. But noise is everywhere in NYC. If you want silence go to the countryside. Anyway good overall value and don't believe everything some people write down here.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here, excellent location! Will come again!”
Reviews.Author: pingvuiini
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Dream Hotel in NYC, August 19-24, 2011. This is my second stay at this hotel, the first being on an Aruba/NYC trip back in August 2008. My friend and I arrived very early on the JetBlue redeye and we were pretty sure our room wouldn't be ready upon arrival. So we dropped off our luggage at the hotel and hit the streets for a bit. Ideally located where all the action is (Broadway/Times Square just south, Central Park a couple blocks to the north, and high end shopping and great restaurants to the east, and most important: nearby subway access!), the Dream Hotel serves as an excellent home base to explore Manhattan. It was my friend's first time at the Dream Hotel, and he felt the room was very good in size and price by NYC standards, with a clean and modern look. They still have the blue accent lighting under the bed and inside the glass top desk. If you are staying in a room for one then its quite a bit smaller. Internet access in the rooms is sorta pricey, but it was reasonably fast. Wifi is available free in the lobby. I am an exercise fanatic and the gym at the hotel is extremely small and basic, but you can go to the front desk and get a pass to Gold's Gym right around two corners from the hotel and work out at a top notch facility. I exercise diligently and this is a fantastic and convenient arrangement with Gold's Gym and the Dream Hotel. The top floors of the hotel house a bar/nightclub that can get pretty loud on weekends. You may see a line of well dressed twentysomethings snaking out the door late Friday and Saturday night. On my visit in 2008 hotel guests were able to go to the bar at any time. Now the arrangement is different, and guests have to wait in line in the lobby with everybody else on busy nights. As mentioned, the Dream Hotel is located in the center of it all, and we did a lot: Central Park Zoo, Museum of Natural History/Rose Center for Space(looking back we should have done to the Guggenheim), taping of the David Letterman show at the Ed Sullivan Theater right across the street form the hotel, rented bikes and rode thru Central Park, east to the Hudson River and all the way down to Battery Park(where we experienced a rare east coast earthquake), then back uptown via 6th Street amongst all the taxis(exciting!). With the metro station so close to the hotel we went about town and saw the Highline Park, antique markets in the Chelsea District, and the New York by Gehry building. Tips for staying at the Dream Hotel: Take the Airtrain from JFK to the E Line(Sutphin Blvd.) and then the E Line east to the 7th Avenue Station. The hotel is just two short blocks away. Total cost should be around $7-8 for both the Airtrain and E Line together. We were unable to take the subway back to JFK because they were closing it down in preparation for an oncoming hurricane. If you take the taxi back to JFK, it says right on the taxi door that the fare to the airport is $45 plus possibly another $5 for a bridge toll. The Park Cafe(861 7th Avenue) just down the street southeast from the hotel and kitty corner. A one minute walk (if that), good food and great prices. We went there twice! Both times were timed right and we were seated quickly, and when we left there were long lines for a table. The best deal in town! If you want to get ripped off, go to Benash Delicatessen across the street from the Park Cafe. $16 for three eggs. There is a reason they don't post their menu on the street for passers-by to look at. I will be visiting NYC/Manhattan again someday for more exploration of a great city. When I do, I will be staying at the Dream Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey H
Reviews.Content: The staff was soooo helpful! I am booking my next stay now!

Reviews.Title: “Is it a Dream?”
Reviews.Author: Restaurantguy51
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel well situated and good staff. Overall not bad. Serafina, the hotel's restaurant was sketchy. Attitude of the staff for breakfast was less than I expected. They were basically rude. The rooms themselves were much smaller than advertised but they were clean.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Nancy A
Reviews.Content: This was a nice surprise for us given that we had never stayed here before. The decor is very modern. Room is inviting when you walk in. It was very clean and a comfortable bed. The fact that they would accept a pet made it even nicer. The staff is welcoming and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: BrandonG828
Reviews.Content: I was here in Sep 2011. The room was dirty; the grout in the shower was black with mold, the floor was dirty, the baseboards had lots of dust and grime on them, the metal shelving in the bathroom was rusted; just gross overall. The real issue that spurred this review is my friend and I each have little red bite marks that, after doing some searching, are very likely bed bug bites. Next time I'm in NYC I'd sleep on the sidewalk before going back to Dream.

Reviews.Title: “Dream is definitely a dream”
Reviews.Author: HPT4Boston
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in fall of 2009 and really enjoyed it. What we loved the most was the location which was very close to Times Square and the rooftop bar which was super hip but laid back. The rooms were recently redone and very nice. However if ultra modern and overwhelming blue lighting bothers you, then this place is not for you. Additionally, we purchased our rooms through an online special which made it super affordable. Normally, the price is $450.00 which is too pricey for what you are getting. We would stay here again but only with an internet deal. We will definitely go back to the rooftop bar whether or not we stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Great bed!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0110
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Dream Hotel in Midtown. I loved the staff- very helpful with some early deiveries for my meeting. The bed was THE MOST comfortable I have ever slept on during travel. Loved the location, windows that opened for the thunderstorm, great lighting in the bathroom and cool blue lights under the bed too! I will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Valentine V
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 9th floor. That was ok. It was a room with a kingsize bed, so that was big enough. There was some noice of the street (honking of cars, trashcars on the street...) Things you can expect staying when staying in the city. On the first look the room was clean, but when you looked under the bed... for example I dropped an empty bottle and 2 days later it was still under the bed. So i picked it up myself. The room was very good looking with the blue light. The staff was there, the doormen where very friendly! The location of the hotel is Superb! Not far from central park, fith av., biking tours and restaurants. I loved the location! The internet in the room was not free, but there's free wifi in the lobby so thats ok!

Reviews.Title: “Average service, but pretty good location”
Reviews.Author: Ramiro B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is indeed well place, within a couple of minutes walk to Columbus circle and Central Park. The rooftop lounge is quite nice, because of the view, but I do think the stafff could be more friendly. Charging 10 dollars a day for Wifi acess is not very nice either, but I guess this is commonplace in American hospitality. The room is quite small but comfortable. I`d say it is a no-frills hotel and has a reasonable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: GennaMoe
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was unbelievably beautiful. The staff was very helpful and friendly. It was in a great location and very easy to find at night while walking around the city. The rooms were very luxurious. After walking around the city all day and half the night, we would come back and just plop down on the bed so tired. The mattress and sheets would envelope you. I think it was the best sleep I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “They should name this hotel the Nightmare Hotel!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria C
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I have stayed at. While the location was excellent, the stuck up rude employees set the tone for the worst hotel experience ever. The room was so tiny that there was no room to even place our bags after shopping. I had to shower sideways in a very old and gross shower!!!! We called for extra pillows and did not get them until 1:00 a.m. Come on, who does that?! The hallway and elevator were tiny as well and coming out of the elevator was a huge picture of an eye. Very tacky.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, easy access to Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: karasznelli
Reviews.Content: Great location, one minute walk to Undreground, 10 minutes ride from Manhattan. Free WIFI works perfect in lobby. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: LawrenceS559
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in March and again in August. Hotel is a boutique hotel with decent sized rooms. Great location and great service.

Reviews.Title: “location was perfect”
Reviews.Author: martinaHly
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in july 11 when we were in ny for a family wedding. the hotels location is perfect, its very clean and comportable. rooms are small eough but that was to be expected. overall i thought this hotel was fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Great trendy hotel. Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rodarg
Reviews.Content: Pros: clean, modern, location, bed, bath, terrace, top lounge, sliders Cons: paid wifi, small room, somehow dark. Highly recommended both for family or couple travel. Maybe not ideal for families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the location!”
Reviews.Author: Kerstin37
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in this midtown-Manhattan hotel. The location could not be better: Times Square, Broadway, and shopping on 5th Avenue are within walking distance. The subway station is just around the corner as well, and it gets you downtown within ten minutes. The hotel is clean, and our room was a decent size with a queen bed. Nice lounge, too, and excellent concierge service!! Reception desk is a little cold, though. And I would stay away from ordering room service - it's outragously expensive; you'll find awesome breakfast places within a short walking distance for a much better deal! Also, stay away from the minibar. It has motion detectors, and prices are high! Great place alltogether, though...

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: neverhome007
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an 8 night stay at the Dream Hotel. The location was great ~ walking distance to Central Park and Times Square. The "fitness center" was a joke - a good sized room with only one old treadmill, two old bikes and a lat machine. Thankfully, they do offer passes to a nearby Gold's Gym. My room was small ~ barely fit a double bed, small desk and a mini bar - the closet was minuscule and I could only find one small drawer to unpack - all that being said, this is the norm for New York. The furniture in the room was worn and there were stains in the bathroom on the floor and mirror. The bed was not very comfortable but the worst part of the stay was the weird noise the a/c unit made randomly ~ all day & all night long. I called the front desk, had the engineer come up to my room but was told that the noise had something to do with the humidity and all of the rooms had this problem. I'm a light sleeper...I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Suz00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Dream for 4 nights in July. The location was supurb, close to Times Square and Central Park. When I checked in I requested a room change from a larger to a smaller room because another person in my party cancelled and they accommodated me with no problem. I had a king bed room. It was a good size for NY standards, clean, nice furnishings, but not much of a view. Other than the few instances of loud guests in the hall and doors slamming late at night (that's ok it's NYC!), I have no complaints. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: oc1996
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night to see a Broadway show. The location of the hotel was perfect. Just a couple blocks from all the shows. This hotel is definitely for the younger crowd. It has a roof top bar with great views of the city. Walking distance to central park and shopping on 5th Ave. Would definitely stay there again. The bed was absolutely wonderful. The staff was helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “For young couples”
Reviews.Author: davetoni
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights. Arrived around midnight and checked in quickly but had to wait 10 minutes for the elevator to our room because they reserved 1 elevator for patrons to the nightclub on the top floor.We asked to use the elevator to go to our room as it wasn't in use but were told by the bouncers we couldn't use it. Eventually got to our room about 1am only to be kept awake by the loud music from the nightclub. We asked to be moved to a room away from the nightclub the next day and got a room that was pretty good except for some street noise. The room was well appointed the shortcoming for us was the lack of coffee and tea making facilities in the room. Wi Fi was free in the public area on the ground floor, staff mostly friendly and helpful but be advised this hotel is clearly aimed at young night clubbers. Great location 10 minutes walk from Central Park and Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not really for families”
Reviews.Author: Moonshell
Reviews.Content: It was ok for our 1 night stay. Booked on hotwire so price was right. After reading other reviews here I called ahead to request a quiet rm as we were traveling with a young child and wanted our sleep! The hotel is clearly targeted at young people heading into the city to party. The 'decorating' is not my style, the rm was very sm (but that's NYC) but it was clean and it was quiet. Most importantly for our short stay was the location- it was perfect. I can see how people might have a horrible time here (noise etc.) but our stay was fine,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel good service great location”
Reviews.Author: douglasKingshott
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in New York and will not be our last when we return we will stay at the Dream again we could not fault it, suggestion if you are elderly like us stay on the first four floors, as the high rooms are nearer the club.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Jtt88
Reviews.Content: Clean quiet great value. I'd stay again. Large roomsx

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In the City!!!!”
Reviews.Author: anaerviti
Reviews.Content: The Dream hotel is by far the best hotel i have ever stayed at in NYC. It was impecable in cleanliness, room was very spacious (rare in NYC), service was outstanding, and it was absolutely gorgeous aesthetically, luxurious, and the price was beyond reasonable for all these 5 star characteristics offered by the Hotel. Very impressed and extremely satisfied. I will only stay there from now on when i visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “cool location, should check it out”
Reviews.Author: Yana123
Reviews.Content: The room is pretty small, no closet but a small closet room for storage. You cannot open the window, but it's fine since the air con works non stop, and you do not want to hear the traffic anyway. The bad is queen size I guess, quite comfy. The annoying blue light can be turned off almost completely what I did a first time I got there. The room overally nice and clean, as well as the bathroom. You have to pay about 10$ for an hour for the WI-fi, but it's free in the lobby. I would say the facilities are 3-4 stars by European standards, cannot comment about the breakfast cause there is now one included and we didn't used the room service. Anyway the hotel location is superb, close to the Times Square and there are plenty of places to eat around. The rooftop bar on the 14 th floor has a fantastic view and very popular according to the number of guests on the elevator going there :) The stuff is friendly and efficient and I would recommend this place to anyone who stays in the city. Of course there is a subway station near by.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, not too big boutique in great location”
Reviews.Author: tomwilson2007
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a good size and well designed. They have that something often lacking in chain hotels in the same category. Everything in the room was clean, new and good quality. The public areas and lounges looked great and had a friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “It's a dream of a place to stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: didisacks
Reviews.Content: staff is friendly and helpful.....could use a little more assistance with restaurants great location for theater nice lobby....could use a little more light in the back area rooms are efficient and more than adequate nice bar...good drinks and snacks

Reviews.Title: “Quarto cheira cigarro, pequeno, escuro, caro”
Reviews.Author: Scarneck
Reviews.Content: O quarto cheira cigarro, embora anunciem que é um Hotel não fumante, terrível.Quarto é pequeno, decoração de gosto duvidoso, escuro, cheio de quinas de aço que machucam, barulhento, banho conta gotas, portas quartos batem e fazem muito barulho acordando todos no corredor, não tem sistema de câmeras, o que facilita pessoas nos corredores falando, brincado ou qualquer tipo de brincadeira que incomoda todos os hospedes.Caro pelo que oferece. Pontos positivo - Localização , atenção dos funcionários.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every minute”
Reviews.Author: Trace299
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on one of my personal "one day getaways." The rooms are smaller than what I was used to, but the quality of the bed and the quietness of the room was fantastic. Truthfully I only knew there was a nightclub when I was leaving the spa (which apparently is no longer there, but was a wonderful experience too) and met some individuals on their way to the rooftop. I enjoyed every minute of it, including the dinner from Serafina that I had delivered to my room. I would definitely recommend this hotel, if you're in the mood for a splurge - it is a bit pricey, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Dream is a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Intl_trvler
Reviews.Content: Left my booking until the last minute, and all of the hotels that I normally stay in were booked. In retrospect, not surprised this one was available. Checked in on Saturday. No-one to take the bags at the front door. The woman who checked me in told me I had been "upgraded" to a 1 bedroom suite on the 13th floor. The hallways in this place are dark and narrow. The room was fine, the white leather furniture all had visible repairs on them and the bathroom was tiny, but overall OK. I returned from an evening out at about midnight to my room where the music from the bar upstairs wasn't just audible, it was making the furniture in the room vibrate!!! How could they sell a room for $350+ when it is impossible to sleep in said room? I went downstairs, the guy at the desk said they're full and "didn't anyone tell you that it would be a loud room when you checked in". I told him that no... in fact i had been told that I had been upgraded. They were booked, I tried a few other hotels on the phone but couldn't get any availability. He eventually put me in their "presidential suite", which was one of the tackiest things I've ever seen (think mirrored walls everywhere, gold leaf on the furniture) but at least it was quiet. When I checked out, I told the person at the front desk again how my stay had been. She asked "hadn't anyone told you it would be a loud room"... when I responded again that I had been told I had been "upgraded" (IE -- the exact opposite!!!) there was no apology, no intention of a discount for my lack of sleep, NOTHING. Totally inexcusable to sell rooms in which people cannot sleep. Clearly they know this (given the queries re: "hadn't you been told...") but they continue on with this terrible business practice. Do not stay here!!! Tons of great hotels in Manhattan, no need to give these jokers your business.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fab hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: marshil2603
Reviews.Content: Just returned from wonderful holiday in NYC. Stayed at the Dream Hotel. I am a travel agent so searched for a long time before I discovered this one. Location couldn't be better, on 55 West Street between Columbus Circle and Times Square. Beds were amazing sooo comfortable. The room and bathroom nice size and seemed to be refubsihed. Checked in by Michael at front desk who gave me choice of 3 different rooms and he was really nice throughout our stay together with all the front desk staff. A special thanks to Edwin the bell boy who both my husband and I thought was wonderful and so friendly. The staff on the whole made you feel very comfortable includng the concierge who were happy to help with questions without feeling that you had to tip everytime you asked a question. Hotel very clean and has a wonderful roof top bar which seemed to be busy every evening. Hope to visit again NY and if i do will definitely stay (if the price is right) at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in NYC if you wanna stay up late and enjoy the night-life”
Reviews.Author: darshparsh
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have been going to Dream Hotel now for over 4 years, every time we come, check-in is relatively painless and quick, the decor in the lobby is quite stunning actually; when walking in you're instantly greeted by a giant two-story glass fish-tank column filled with exotic saltwater fish and a beautiful statue of Catherine the Great, superb. Service is very good, and you shouldn't have any problem getting whatever you want at any time of day or night. I've seen people complain on here (tripadvisor) about this place, and honestly this is not a family hotel or a place for older people. The rooms are very small, backlit with black lights and very modern decor, wifi of course. Works for me, NYC is a fun town, so get out there! Or if you're feeling like not straying to far, take the elevator to the club on the roof and have some drinks with a great atmosphere. The restaurant Serafima downstairs is also very good. Unfortunately the Chopra Center Spas are no longer located downstairs, which - in my opinion, sealed the deal for this hotel being the place to stay. I've heard there is a similar type spa at the Chatwaal (at the recommendation of the Chopra Center Spas), if you're interested. Anyways overall, great experience and a fun hotel to stay at, can't miss it when you're walking down west 55th, its the giant glowing blue hotel, fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “dreamy indeed!”
Reviews.Author: kmccolli
Reviews.Content: A fantastic boutique hotel just north of Times Square and very close to Central Park. I was so impressed by the friendly and accommodating service (front desk and concierge) and the overall vibe. As you can see from the pictures on the hotel (and trip advisor) website, the lobby is really cool with the 2 story fish tank and lounging area. We stayed on the 12th floor in a large king. The room was indeed very large for a NYC hotel, extremely comfortable bed, great bathroom, etc. We slept incredibly well the entire stay and were not disturbed even once by other guests or patrons of the roof top lounge, Ava. Speaking of which, we hosted a small gathering of friends at Ava on the Friday we were there and had a great time. The lounge has an exceptional view of Broadway/Times Sq (looks directly onto the Ed Sullivan Theater where Letterman tapes) and even more exceptional cocktails! We also ate (a few times!) in Serafina, the Italian restaurant just off the hotel lobby. The food was excellent and fairly reasonable for the area. Highly recommend! An additional highlight of our stay was the location. I appreciated the proximity to Times Sq without being right in the middle of it. Even better, you are just a short walk to Central park, numerous subway stops, and even Grand Central. In summary, I can't imagine staying anywhere else the next time I go to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Price and Staff Need work”
Reviews.Author: Nickj2323
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice - really cool lobby, exterior blue lights at nighttime, a different big interesting picture on each floor, etc., but the price for the room was a little pricey. The room was clean and the bed was really comfortable, but for the size of the room, the price could have been at least $50 cheaper. Other than that, my only complaint would be the staff...The hotel has a very nice roof-top bar/lounge, but because it was a Sat night (I guess?), it was packed and the people working were not pleasant or helpful. Being a guest of the hotel, you would think you would get priority access, but that wasn't the case. We took the elevator up to the lounge and were told to go back down to the lobby and have our ID's checked, and wait in line. Then, once we finally got up to the lounge, they were not allowing anyone else to go up to the rooftop - the whole scene was just too forced and unfair. Maybe during the week it is not like this, but it was definitley a turnoff. We also requested a DVD player in our room and didn't recieve one. When we called about it, the front desk said they were not available until the next day. But, the location and atmosphere of the hotel were really great. I would just be a little hesitant to go back because of the customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Love the rooftop bar!”
Reviews.Author: Gecko21
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed there, but I'd recommend the rooftop bar. It can get a little sceney, but the views are worth it, even if you just go up for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: juanbau
Reviews.Content: Nice place, stayed there 6 nights. Visit from Argentina. They charge 10 dollars for wifi. Too much!

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: steferx
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my one night stay at the Dream Hotel. I went with my 2 children 5 and 8. The hotel was beautiful. The room was pretty large for NYC. The bed was very comfortable. There are 2 nice bars and a restaurant. But the service was AMAZING! All of the Bell staff, the front desk, especially Remma and Mary, were friendly and helpful. The room service was super quick. They even sent a maintenance man up to help get the packing off my son's new toy purchase because it required a screw driver. Evenyone gave us money saving tips for the hotel and the city. Even the elevators were fast! I will return.

Reviews.Title: “My stay”
Reviews.Author: nvrhme
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the dream Hotel this past weekend. I had researched and found positive and negative reviews. The worker at the front desk was very nice and helpful. My room was on the second floor and not too far from the elevators, which were two things that concerned me. The first thing I noticed were the blue lighte in the room and on the desk. and ceiling which I quckly turned off for the entire stay. The room was small, but not tiny. The bathroom had a standing shower with no tub. The closet was a small corner with no door. The view was dark and of the rooms and building on the other side of the hotel. The amenities were were fine. The elevator and being on the second floor turned out not to be a problem. If you don't plan on spending a lot of time in your hotel room this hotel is fine. I myself would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Dream is a dream”
Reviews.Author: babynp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited NYC earlier this month and thoroughly enjoyed staying at the Dream NY. The hotel is clean and decorated beautifully. The location was ideal for what we wanted to do in the city. It is near Central Park, Times Square and MOMA. The staff was very helpful with everything we needed, from late check in to directions on riding the subway and hailing taxis. We plan to return to NYC and will definitely stay at the Dream again K. Sparks-Tuscaloosa, AL

Reviews.Title: “Youth Hostel accomodations at Waldorf Prices”
Reviews.Author: shagbug
Reviews.Content: great location, but the rooms were extra-small, hallways narrow,dirty and dimly lit. There was blood on the bathroom towels and the room smelled of sewage. One staff member was nice, the others were horrible. This might be a worthwhile discount room if it were $95 a night, but north of $300 is obscene for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Get a Handicapped Accessible Room if You Don't Have to”
Reviews.Author: krystynlo
Reviews.Content: DREAM used to be one of the corporate hotels of my company (it is no longer), and having stayed there several times in the past, I decided to stay there again. The room I was given -- 801, if memory serves -- had to be one of the most depressing hotel rooms I've ever seen. An internal room directly next to the elevator, there were no windows, save one frosted on in the bathroom, and the shower had no walls, so when I showered, I drenched the bathroom. Laying down towels helped dry the floor, except that they quickly became sopping and cold. Luckily I had earplugs, or the noise related to the elevator being inches away would have been disruptive. I was THIS CLOSE to asking for another room, but the hotel's front desk people didn't seem terribly friendly, so I decided to just stay since I was only going to be in the city for 12 hours or so. That's on me, for sure. I should have asked to be moved. The location is great, and the hotel is clean, so there's that. Just maybe do what I didn't do, and if you're given one of the internal rooms, see if the hotel will move you.

Reviews.Title: “My new home away from home- I won't stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: taralightner
Reviews.Content: The staff, the facility, the rooms and the amentities- all outstanding. I've never had a hotel experience where each and every staff member consistently showed that they cared about me and my comfort. At every turn, they met my needs- even anticipated them. I just won't stay anywhere else when I go back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice rooms. Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ballencrieff
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. A bit trendy for my taste, but the location was great - just minutes from Central Park and Times Square. Room was clean and reasonably spacious. Lots of 24hr pharmacies around and you are spoilt for choice for local Delis and restaurants. Had some TV problems. V-chip was activated so a lot of regular networks were blocked for some reason. Asked staff to fix this, but they were confused about what was wrong. If staying here, visit the "Soup Nazi" shop (of Seinfeld fame) which is just a hundred yards on the same street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the location and iff u get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Aman-India
Reviews.Content: I stayed there as i wanted to stay near the times square. A friend of mine recommended this place. For the 200 USD i paid for the room....definitely worth it... Because u are staying right on the times square.. Ask for the room facing the broadway and also there is no noise in the room as other people have written.In times square, one doesnt stay in the room during the day and in the night , u need a place to crash.... and this was perfect for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay .. Friendly staff, Clean room, Nice decoration, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Liverpoolia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very nice location few blocks from times square. I enjoyed my stay there, the room was clean and nicely decorated. The price is reasonable in comparison to other hotels and staff is really friendly. Overall i would rank it as a very good !!

Reviews.Title: “Dream is a comfortable, convenient hotel in a perfect location with a wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: elephant333
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Dream before and liked the location, accommodations and val;ue. When we checked in this time there was confusion with our reservation. Thankfully Angie, one of the managers, took care of making everything all right for our three night stay. Her main concern was that we were happy and comfortable. She could not have been more gracious. The staff at the Dream is terrific, from the valet, to the bellmen to the desk and housekeeping. The bed was terrific and the room was clean. We had a wonderful stay and would definiitely reserve at this hotel again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel but not sleeping...”
Reviews.Author: Avalonavalon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location. The hotel has great staff. The hotel is unusual in decor but interesting and done well. The downside of the hotel (and maybe it was because we were on the 4th floor) is that we did not sleep at all. The sounds from outside and the traffic kept BOTH of us up all night. It does not have enough soundproofing or whatever is needed to muffle the sounds. Maybe a higher floor room would be better but I'm not sure. Just wanted to share this because it did have a major impact on our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, value - love to stay here when in NY”
Reviews.Author: vvance
Reviews.Content: Love staying here as service is so personal in this intimate setting. Rooms are compact but offer much better working area and lighting than most hotels. Beds are very comfortable. Love this location - close to everything: shows, restaurants, museums. I always feel at home here.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: dagmar_11
Reviews.Content: good location: near many interesting places, but not too 'touristic', subway nearby. room very small, but quiet ! And well furnished. Cleaning service was excellent, also very friendly and service-oriented. Late check-out was not possible - annoying when you leave in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “"The Dream" really is a dream place to stay in the big apple”
Reviews.Author: FoodShoesHandbags
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Dream and once again everything was perfect. Everyone made me feel incredibly welcome in a very genuine way. Location is perfect - walking distance to all my favourite shops and eateries. I shall definitely be returning to the Dream when next in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “All night partying - like a college dorm”
Reviews.Author: luckieeloo
Reviews.Content: First of all - this is not a hotel for families. This is probably also not a hotel for a romantic weekend in New York. This is a hotel for friends having fun in the city, and who would like to go dancing at a hot club. The scene: The hotel has a club in their basement that pumps loud salsa music on Saturday nights. I actually would've loved to go dancing if my friends were there that night. It's right in Times Square, which means easy access to the subways and almost any type of entertainment. In addition the hotel is outfitted with these neon blue lights and "modern/chic" images of naked women holding their breasts and a large eye, that type of thing. You will hear the noises from the visitors in adjacent rooms. They'll probably be laughing hysterically, or you know.... They also have a penthouse club that is very popular. Overall Experience: Stay here if you don't mind the party. The rooms are secure and pretty clean. They are tiny, of course, but it's New York City. The bed is comfortable and you won't be bothered. Definitely stay here if you're looking for a fun time with your friends who like to party. Other: You have to pay for the wifi which I feel is a joke given that even the Hampton Inn gives you free wireless. Also the elevator can take a long time, so be patient. They don't hold many people and will stop on almost every floor. The service is average. They won't go out of their way, but they'll smile and be polite as you check in and out.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: velouba
Reviews.Content: between Christmas and New Year, extremely well located hotel. frontdesk very helpful. roomsize great. clean with extremely comfortable bed. sole downside, not soundproof neither from corridor nor from street. restaurant was very expensive therefore we rather went to the many delis and other diners in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for seeing everything New York has to offer”
Reviews.Author: jakif
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and accommodating. Rooms were not large but clean and adequate. The location is perfect for theatre, restaurants and as a home base for all the other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service was the only thing good about DREAM”
Reviews.Author: musicmama28
Reviews.Content: Booked DREAM for the location and because of a decent rate. It was not even worth the decent rate.
