The staff really does an excellent job of helping in all ways possible, but that is where the positive feedback ends. The sitting area of the lobby is odd and not comfortable. The elevators are way too small (fits max 2 people each with 1 piece of luggage would be my guess) and the blue light theme just didn't add anything to the ambiance of the hotel, so it just felt odd. Simply put, the room I had was beat up and awful. It was in serious need of many touch ups, fixes and a major cleaning (especially the bathroom floor and shower tiles). Gross. I stayed for one night and chose to leave ahead of schedule in the morning so I could shower at home instead of at this hotel. Hotels should be comfortable escapes from home, and this was the opposite. The walls, doors and light switches were all very visibly dirty. The most annoying thing was the toilet. It basically made a slow trickle noise the entire time I was in my room, and every 20 minutes it would make a loud noise (maybe because a neighbor flushed? who knows). Definitely needed maintenance but I was too tired to move rooms or complain because of it. I also did not enjoy hearing the alarm of the person in the next room. Very thin walls! All I have to say is thank God I was only in the room for 7 hours (including sleep time). If they give the entire hotel a major cleaning and overhaul so it matches the quality of their service, it would be a nice hotel. At this moment, however, I cannot recommend. 4 stars!? Absolutely not. 2 1/2 is more appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocrity in all ways”
Reviews.Author: danlevy
Reviews.Content: You can take an old midtown apartment building and put fancy decor and blue lights on it, but it's still going to have the creaky old bones of a century old building. All night long we could hear water flushing through the old old pipes. The rooms are SMALL. If you are going to use the room as a staging area for a trip to NYC and won't spend any waking time in it, sure, but the so-called ergonomic desk was way too high for the not-comfortable chair. There is little chance one could get any work done in this hotel. And, really, should a hotel really charge for wi-fi in 2011? Then, there's the security, a couple of guys in the lobby who are really bouncers for the penthouse nightclub. Anyone could get by them in a breeze and enter the guest hallways. Kind of a disappointing place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with top quality service, great restaurant, fun pent-house bar”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnnBinghamton_NY
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend staying at Dream (in NYC). Without asking, I received a free upgrade (from a single to a double). The room was immaculately clean, the sheets were white and crisp (and I did check for those rumored "bed bugs" that everyone says are haunting NYC hotels! The bathroom was also lovely. The only convenience missing was a 2 cup coffee maker. I will definitely stay there again in the future. We had a delicious meal right at the hotel restaurant (Italian), reasonably priced, and an after-dinner drink in the pent-house bar, which has a remarkable view of the city. Very memorable and reasonably priced (for NYC).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, nice rooms, great view from the lounge”
Reviews.Author: bpinedc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an excellent stay on a cold weekend in January. 7 other couples - friends of ours -also stayed in the hotel and though we were not a formal "group", we were treated very well. The rooms were very clean and nice and decorated in a simple-chic fashion. We stayed in a Queen room that was more than adequate in size. The bathroom was small but clean and fully functional. More counter space would have been nice, but it was not a problem. Everything worked throughout the room and bathroom. We were going to Lincoln Center to see the Opera so the location was great - walkable in about 5-10 minutes. Also quick access to the subway and two blocks from Central Park for an early morning run. Disappointing that the Chopra spa in the basement was closed, but that is a separate establishment from the hotel and not noticeable other than the fact we were excited about an easy massage. The Ava Lounge upstairs was awesome! Fabulous views down Broadway, great staff, not overcrowded. Really fun and lively without being a crazy club. We had Sunday brunch at Serafina the restaurant in the lobby and it was delightful. Great breads and yummy egg dishes, good bloody marys pleasant service and only about $20 pp. One downside was that elevators were a little slow, but not too big a problem. Would definitely recomend the hotel and will likely stay again on upcoming business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest bed I have ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: 30soph
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice rooms and much bigger than I thought they would be, clean comfy and quiet, everything you want in a hotel. Front desk staff pretty grumpy but otherwise nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: koolmer5
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great lobby. Youthful staff. Older building, renovated beautifully although maintains some feeling of an older building - small elevators, slightly broken in windows, etc. Great looking room with blue underlighting, decent plasma/LCD TV built into wall. Supplied forgotten toiletries, beautiful view straight into Times Square down 7th Avenue. Standard smaller room size that is too be expected with a downtown/midtown Manhattan hotel. Similarly, ambient noise from the street was present but understandable. Had the cheapest room available and was comfortable in the square footage. The location is hard to beat. Beds were very comfortable. Room did not have Ipod dock, rather had a Bose Radio system instead. Subway routes very close to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: misskeys78
Reviews.Content: We are on a trip across the USA and spent christmas in New York (four days). This was our first visit to NYC. This was one of the few hotels I allowed the travel agent to book as I am quite fussy about cleanliness and service. She is a friend of mine and has stayed here and assured me it was an amazing hotel. I understand that space is hard to come by in the Big Apple so we expected small rooms for a hefty price. The location of Dream hotel (mid manhattan) is amazing and made it so easy to get around NYC. We had some fabulous resturants and attractions nearby and hells kitchen was approx 8 minute walk away. We didn't order room service at Dream- there's so many fantastic places to eat in NYC its almost criminal to do this!! On arrival the door staff were very helpful and the lobby looks modern and funky. There is a novel feature in the lobby too! Unfortunately the staff at the front desk were uninterested in checking us in. Lucky we had the lobby feature to stare at while we waited. When they did get around to checking us in, the woman at the front desk was indifferent, bordering on unfriendly. She was like this throughout our whole stay. We were booked in the cheapest room type. Our room was well appointed, well maintained, clean, and as expected very small. I personally did not like the layout and style, I felt they were trying a bit too hard to be modern and edgy without pulling it off and wasting valuable space in the process. Again this is personal taste but the blue light under the bed and in the writing desk reminded my of public toilets in dodgey places, luckily we finally found the switch and turned them all off! The Dream has a small enclosed roof top bar where we had a couple of drinks. The view is great. We also had a drink in the bar on the street, which is nice. Again staff were not interested in us, but we stayed for one drink. On the second day a friendly staff member mentioned they only had 50% occupancy. I plucked up the courage to ask the front desk lady for an upgrade. She said they could upgrade us for an extra $60 per night to a King bed room. I asked to look first. One of the staff showed us the room. It was perhaps 1m wider than our room. We decided not to bother. The front desk staff really let this place down. The other staff, including the conceirge were great though. If I was to visit NYC again I don't think I would stay here. Given that I'm not sure what the standard is in NYC as I haven't stayed anywhere else I would be hesitant to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy lobby, standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: Vauka
Reviews.Content: The hotel wows you with a glitzy lobby with large statue, aquarium with colorful fishes and luxurious looks. Check in was friendly and smooth. The elevators are constantly overloaded, one of them out of order for several short times during our stay. The room was small and surprisingly basic for a five star hotel. The bathroom is small and even more basic (bathtub with shower curtain, no shower). The mysterious blue light underneath the bed comes from a loose lamp holder simply tucked underneath the bed.... The location of the hotel however is absolutely great. Also breakfast and dinner in Serafina Restaurant on the ground floor of the hotel were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel off the Park”
Reviews.Author: CristinaSarasota
Reviews.Content: I am a NYC (Upper East Side) native and I have stayed only twice in hotels. This was a jewel, conveniently located on W 55 - near some great restaurants and diners.......Most of all it was clean - I was very worried about bedbugs....The staff was wonderful, bathroom amenities plentiful and luxurious bathrobes too! Because I was a member of the IPrefer club I had free internet in the room. The hotel is very eclectic with a 2-story aquarium in the lobby. I would definitely return there.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and exclusive hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: sebosay
Reviews.Content: From the first moment you are entering the hotel you recognizing that this is a special one. The room I stayed wasn't that big, but it was ok as solo traveller. The rooms have a great design as well as the hotel itself. After I left the hotel I learned from a friend living in NYC that the hotel and its lounges are very popular. The Italian restaurant wasn't that good. The location is great. Just a couple minutes of walking for 5th Av., Time Square and others. I had a room with a window from with you could see the Time Square. My room number was 817! One negative point is the construction on the opposite site of the hotel. The are starting very early :(

Reviews.Title: “A "DREAM" to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnymc75
Reviews.Content: Dream NY is a great hotel mainly because of the super friendly staff. The rooms are comfortable, most notably the beds. So hard to get out of bed.....the room was clean, quiet and well appointed. The Ava lounge in the roof was amazing and cozy. We just had a great stay and would highly recommend Dream NY to anyone coming to the city for work or play!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: justinz24
Reviews.Content: Dream is a nice hotel in the midtown area of NYC. It has a cool ambiance, and a very cool bar called AVA. The rooms are small, but for a few dollars more you can get a "Medium" or "Large" room, and I would recommend that route. It is a cool option for not a ton of money.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about the ambiance...”
Reviews.Author: Galila
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel in a great midtown location. For those who always complain about the room sizes in NY, I recommend the enormous King Size room for a few dollars more - well worth it. My room faced the back - no view but very quiet - a must for NYC. I loved the room ambiance with strategically located blue lighting for a serene atmosphere. Nice touch. As for the rest, a most decent hotel with a fine connecting Italian restaurant. Clean rooms, efficient service - everything you'd expect at this level.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't even get a reservation”
Reviews.Author: foodman
Reviews.Content: I called 3 times to get a rate. Each time they transferred me to an unstaffed phone line which rang out. If they put that much care/attention into new bookings and business I hate to imagine how they treat people who have already paid. Forget it! I'll pay the same rate and get my Marriott points and I know someone will answer the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YellowMel
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel; very modern, clean and comfortable. Within walking distance to shopping and shows, great location overall. Serafina's Broadway is also located in the lobby and has excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TuckSpenc
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our time at Dream. Staff was always helpful. Loved the roof top lounge. Beds comfy but a little too warm with the down comforters under the bottom sheet. Couldn't get cool enough. Got an upgrade to two queen beds and I think that was good because any smaller bed would have been uncomfortable. Good and helpful tips from busboy and concierge. Front staff mostly only suggested their restaurant for a place to go. The bell boys and concierge were best at recommending places. Loved Trattoria Della Arte for dinner nearby even though a little pricey. Had breakfast at Apple Jacks across the street every day and it was reasonably priced, good food and friendly and quick service. Loved New York. Wished we could have stayed longer. We were there for 3 nights precruise to New England and Canada. Glad we made some time for New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, service, location...”
Reviews.Author: CK60
Reviews.Content: We just got back and, while I do hate to say it, The Dream was a dream. The lobby is an experience that puts you in the mood. Blue lighting and fish tank pillars. The room, although a bit stark and very white, was bigger than expected and incredibly comfortable. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and we loved the view from the Penthouse Bar. Definitely going to stay there again... great location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and interior decorating for a good price in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mar3ee
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a hotel in Manhattan, but I've been to the city many times before. This hotel is a great deal for being in the heart of the Times Square area and right next to the subway. The hotel is beautifully decorated, clean, and has wonderful service. Everyone working there is friendly and quite helpful. We were able to keep our luggage there the whole next day even after we checked in. The room could have been a little bigger but the modern design and layout was very pleasing. Definitely will be going back for my next visit! The only downside was trying to get a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “A $350 a night hole in the wall....”
Reviews.Author: frenchlead
Reviews.Content: Terrible place....almost $400 dollars a night for a room that made it impossible to take two steps without bumping into a wall, table or your significant other....Oh...and a great view to a...wall...made me think I was a character in The Shawshank Redemption....Silly decoration and terrible customer service...avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mwhiton
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. Close to 5th Ave. and Central Park, and there was a subway right out the door. A friend and I stayed for the weekend and had a great time. The room was ready when we arrived and got to go right up. The elevators were a little small but it was no big deal. The room was good for the two of us, perfect size. It was clean and the AC worked well. The only thing that didn't work was the phone but we didn't use it anyway. We did forget to pack conditioner but the hotel offered complementary shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and lotion. They had one of the great magnifying mirrors too. There was a flat screen TV in the room, with a mini-bar and a safe. The only thing the room didn’t offer, which I would have preferred is a little refrigerator. But the hotel was very nice and everyone was very friendly. The bed was super comfy and at night we could not hear the traffic, honking horns, and sirens. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wickes36
Reviews.Content: Seriously, this place is awful. Hugely expensive with tiny rooms. Noisy at all times of the day and with utterly unattentive staff. We were drawn to the sound of good restaurants only to find that one of them was a totally separate place on Broadway that just happened to be accessible by a series of subterranean passageways. Not part of the hotel at all. Similarly the spa - totally separate but sold as part of the hotel experience. The roof bar was almost always unmanned when we went for a drink, so we spent a good 20 minutes sitting waiting for service only to get up and walk away again. We paid around $350.00 per night only to find friends around the corner (Central Park South) were paying around $100.00 less and were being treated like royalty. Don't fall for a good website folks, it looks like a boutique hotel but it's really a funky reception and nothing else. Sorry Dream Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: trosenbaum
Reviews.Content: Tiniest hotel rooms and very noisy. Not to mention that the service there was horrible. Above all else, the hotel charged me twice for my booking charge - They charged me again 2 months after my stay for a higher amount, an amount to which was never signed off on. They won't even let me dispute it as the money went through already through my bank. This is a shady hotel and I would advise to put your money into a larger hotel company - such as Starwood.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Dream or a Beauitful Nightmare....”
Reviews.Author: jetset1909
Reviews.Content: Either way I did not want to leave. Amazing location. Great Staff! The highlight of this stylish NYC Hotel is the enormous bathroom. I have seriously never been to a hotel in NYC with such ample space in the bathroom. The price was awesome! Be sure to check out the roof top bar. But the fitness center was a little disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: Lucien69
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to New York since 1974, and stayed in a number of diferent hotels. This one is undoubtfully the worse. Tiny room at 300 $ a night( when I complained, they gave give me a slightly larger one, after trying to charge an extra 30$), noisy AC, no sound insulation (you hear construction work from the street starting at 5 am). I called them a few days later to check if I had forgoten something I couldn't find; left 3 messages on an answering machine. They never returned the calls. This is the first time in my life I write a report about a hotel. I feel it is my duty to avoid other people beeing ripped off like I was.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is really a club for the floozie drunk crowd. It is dangerous and loud”
Reviews.Author: anchorslaurel
Reviews.Content: The hotel caters to to the "wild" nightclub crowd seeking loud music and sex partners. There is loud horrible music playing in the lobby at night and in the "penthouse" that is sought after by this low class group. The fire alarm went off twice in the night and was set off by overcrowinding in the elevators and simply bad behaviors. We were woken up and ran down the stairs (which are narrow, circular and dangerous in the event of a real disaster) to find a bunch of drunken revelers and no danger. We heard the siren and ran down from the 4th floor but my daughter, on the 9th floor, never even heard the alarm and noone did anything to alert the people on the upper levels. If it had been a real fire, it was a disaster waiting to happen. The staff is nice but stupid. This hotel is all "flash" and should be fined and closed down until they make it safe. In addition, there was a group of young women (definitely not ladies) next door to us that were loudly reveling all night and continued regardless of the fact that we called the reception to get them to quiet down and at least two other guests on our floor also called.

Reviews.Title: “Boring”
Reviews.Author: kikepinedo
Reviews.Content: It´s just an expensive room to sleep if you want to be close to Broadway Av. Some rooms, like mine, have view to a wall.

Reviews.Title: “Dream is a small dream....”
Reviews.Author: SMW2010
Reviews.Content: Location is within blocks of Time Square. The summer rate was $200 a night for a king size bed. The room itsself was the smallest Ive ever stayed in compaired to other states. Had flat screen TV, small desk, and shower with two heads. Its contemporary looking with blue lights and fish tank and the entrance. Elevators are VERY small. Like a 1/2 bath size. Pack light! Parking is 25 per day if you park your self/ 45 if they do it. Do not bring oversized car. This city is very compact.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Hotel is fine”
Reviews.Author: royaashcroft
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel as recomended by Aussie travel agent, found it to be value for money, great location, staff very helpful and had no problems at all, overall a good hotel to stay at at its price bracket

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, fairly priced boutique hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Allyor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night here and it was everything that we needed - hip, great location, clean and a helpful staff. Yes, the room was very small, but perfect for one or two nights. The bed was very comfortable, the bath products were L'Occitane (very nice) and it was surprisingly quiet on the tenth floor. My only complaint would be the air conditioning unit switching on and off during the night. I would not have stayed here, or at least in the "double room" that we had, with our kids. Just not conducive to a family.

Reviews.Title: “If customer service was an art, they'd be a master”
Reviews.Author: clarkdreams
Reviews.Content: I have never in my life, especially in a city like New York dealt with more kind and understanding people! First off, the hotel is a gem. The location is out of this world (right in midtown with a Crumbs a block away :)), but it is just far out of the center of Times Square to give the tired traveler a little peace and quiet. The room is spacious and comfortable, great bed linens and awesome bathroom. What is most important, however, are the people who work there. Being pregnant, I called a day in advance to request something quiet. They placed me on the 14th floor, far from the elevator and upgraded my room with no charge. The morning I was supposed to check out, I ran into an emergency and ended up being almost 4 hours late for check out. I informed them, and they, without hesitation said that it was no problem. i figured I'd be charged for my delay, but once again, they went above and beyond and didn't charge me a dollar. I don't think I'd ever stay anywhere else in New York after this fantastic stay at the Dream!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: rosemary027
Reviews.Content: The photographers did a great job with selling the hotel, unfortunately, the reality of the hotel itself was terrible. The toilet did not work, rooms were small and they did not have amenities like ice. They would not match the price from the previous night and raised it $70. The rooms were small and lobby had no place to sit. The staff was not friendly. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing management”
Reviews.Author: jane1313
Reviews.Content: So staying in busy central hotels on business can be a drag and there are always problems along the way....the main thing is how the management deal with it. 5 stars for Duty Manager Anne at Dream who made all the small issues at the start of the trip disappear into a distant memory. Excellent customer service, nice space, cool roof top bar in the evenings - book early if it's a sunny day unless you want to stand

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but the floor was hard”
Reviews.Author: KelownaBOY
Reviews.Content: We gave our olders daughter a trip to New York for her graduation from high school. She has always wanted to go. I booked our trip with Flight Centre in Kelowna BC. My dates were flexable so we got a better price. I told our agent Chealsea we must have 2 beds. So it was booked as such. Befor we left I confirmed our flight (on time) and our hotel (Dream). The hotel staff told me I was booked into a single room with a queen bed. One bed !!! I requested to be moved but was told they were booked. No problem just give me a cott (small fold out bed). She said they don't have any. What ? I tryed to get into another hotel but my agent said I would have to pay for that hotel ALSO. So I knew I would have to sleep on the floor. We arrived at the airport to find our flight delayed and we would not make our connection to Newark so we were diverted to Seatle then Newark. We made it to Newark and hopped on the bus then train and then walked 13 blocks to our hotel. A hint here...take the shuttle its only $19 one way. We checken in. The staff was friendly. Our roon was on the first floor facing 7th ave so it was busy but the room was very quiet. easy to fall asleep. My daughter said the bed was nice to sleep on. But I was on the floor. I used 4 comforters and a blanket and slept well. Our room was small. As was the bath room. The upside was it was very clean ! The room service staff was great as was the reception desk. The hotel is a very short walk to the south end of Central Park and Broadway. The subway is near the corner of the hotel and will take you every place. You must go to Carnagies Deli just around the corner. Order the pastromi on rye. The sandwitch had a half pound of pastromi on it and tasted great !!! Lots of shopping. If you want a "I love NY" t-shirt you can get them for $3 each. I did see them as low as 12 for $25. Dont buy at the airport they want 2 for $20. Overall the hotel is not a 4 star but a solid 3 star. They give it the extra star for location. With that said the hotel was clean, quiet, centally located, friendly staff, and not over priced. You could do much worse. NY was great. The local people were freindly and helpful and we felt safe even at 2am. Go and enjoy your trip. If you have questions just email or call me. Rick

Reviews.Title: “Dream a little dream... at the dream!”
Reviews.Author: holidaykitty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dream for our honeymoon in Feb 2009. Check in was fast and we were pleasently surprised to be upgraded to a King Room. It had very funky decor and although on the small side, the space was very well used. I havent stayed anywhere else in New York City, but i did hear all rooms were not as big as expected. Bose sound system in the room was a great touch. I loved the bed, the doona cover and sheets were so comfortable that I didnt want to get out of bed in the morning. The bathroom was very clean and all soaps and things were replaed everyday. The only negative comment I have was you had to be up very early in the morning if you wanted a hot shower as we found it quite difficult to have a hot shower during the day. (Mind you, it was -10 degrees celsius outside!) Location was brilliant, walking distance to Times Square and the Empire State building. There is also a subway station near the corner of the hotel which we used to take to Soho and surrounding areas. All in all, i would definitley stay here again, I loved it and the location was close enough to everything and it was nice and quiet!

Reviews.Title: “There is much better hotels in NY than this one...”
Reviews.Author: DJ_Bev
Reviews.Content: Arrived and my deluxe room not available. Front desk have an attitude problem. No ones room was ready even when they were arriving late afternoon/early evening. there are some great hotels in NY for this price, id stay in one that makes you geel welcome....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: SDTripster
Reviews.Content: Finding a decent hotel in NYC at the right price can sometimes be very, very difficult. You will love the Dream Hotel for the price, location and quality. I will definitely stay here again and again. First: the price - I booked it online using one of the services and got a great deal - less that $175/night which is incredible for such a great property in such a great location. 2nd: it's location - midtown Manhattan with Times Sq, Central Park and most major subway lines a block or two away - is absolutely perfect. Third, the quality of the rooms is terrific - I stayed in two different rooms on a 4 night stay. They are very clean, painted brilliant white, with brushed steel and dark-wood furnishing, and a clever minimalist design that is pleasant, fun and perfect for business or pleasure. The rooms are no smaller than any other Manhattan hotel and the little amenities - Bose stereo, safe, lighted magnifying mirror on a swivel arm in the bathroom, incredibly comfortable bed, and the upscale toiletries - all make this hotel really terrific. The staff - even the maintenance guy I met in the elevator - are all very friendly, professional and sincere. Despite the TA warnings, I never had to wait very long for an elevator, even when the kids were lined up outside on Friday night to visit the bar on the top floor. One small word of caution: ask for a "quiet" room on a high floor and at the back - NOT overlooking 55th St. or Broadway - those streets are just too noisy. Again, this is a great property - you could easily pay $300-$400 a night at another hotel and not get anything this good.

Reviews.Title: “out of the ordinary luxury and fun!”
Reviews.Author: anthonyskibeer
Reviews.Content: had an amazing time at dream...the staff was extremely helpful and polite, the room was more amazing than i could imagine with amenities like flat screens, bose sound systems, fluffy bathrobes, huge comfey bed and furniture, double shower, free hbo, ect....the best part was the italian restaraunt and rmfifty5 lounge with no cover and a live DJ all night, and also the private elevator up the the rooftop bar and lounge, also with a DJ and no cover! AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, and it shows.”
Reviews.Author: wskitche
Reviews.Content: I'm not a particularly picky person, but when I'm paying $300 per night for a hotel room, I have expectations relating to style, accommodations, and staff helpfulness - this hotel met none of them. I also expect my room not to have thrift store carpet and a smell like bowling-alley shoes. The lobby is nice, but it is merely the guilded cover to this motel-6ish book. In any case, we left after the first night and stayed somewhere else for the rest of our trip. Very good move. My advice is to spend $50 more per night on a better hotel (the incremental gain will be huge) or, if you can't afford that, stay in Brooklyn at a much cheaper hotel thats probably much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a supurb location”
Reviews.Author: Cegeva
Reviews.Content: A hotel with a fantastic location between Times Square and Central Park, at the corner Broadway/55th Street. Goos service, friendly staff, clean and neat rooms. Quit even though close to Broadway. Free internet at the lobby, but not in the rooms. Very, very close to metro. We highly recomend Dream hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: witch1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night and it met our expectations by far. Very clean, lobby staff are excellent. The beds are, by far, the most comfortable I have stayed in away from home. The roof top bar is very nice. The bar on the first floor was also nice. Very retro. neon lights are every where. I would def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “****Best Hotel****”
Reviews.Author: Campino666
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March 10. I travelled to NY with my Boyfriend. We went for 4 nights. Was amazing! Was a little expensive to drink in. The hotel itself has two bars to pick from. One on the ground floor and one on floor 14. Once you had enough and want to go to bed you won't hear anything. Neo lights on the floor! Setting the mood. Of course you can switch them off if you want. Great service everyone wants to help. AMAZING location! 2 min walk from Time Square! Don't listen to the bad reviews! Lets be honest you 9 times out of 10 you will only right a review if you had a bad time! Take it from a Travel agent.... Hotel is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: jkharri
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed her for five nights on a trip to Manhattan. The hotel is very very nice, very very clean, and in an excellent location. There is a subway station at the end of the block, central park is a two minute walk north, times square a five minute walk south. The neighborhood is very safe and secure, as is the hotel. Prior to staying, I saw a lot of reviews saying the rooms are too small. The room wasn't enormous, but was spacious enough to spend five nights in comfortably. We even had to spend about five hours in the room during a huge storm that kept us inside, and never felt cramped. I highly reccomend this hotel. The price is great, the location perfect, the room clean. Cannot ask for much else. If you stay, eat at the serafina (connected to the hotel). The food was delicious. There is a little cafe about a half block south on Broadway - they have breakfast sandwiches (egg cheese and sausage on a croissant) for $2 - great way to start the day and save a little money.

Reviews.Title: “Where Potential 6 Columbus Guests Should Stay”
Reviews.Author: mjpalm
Reviews.Content: See my review and many others like it on 6 Columbus. If you are looking for a chic hip hotel in NYC in a good neighborhood on the west side seek out Dream Hotel. Perhaps one of the most comfortable beds in NYC. Hip neon blue lighting in the room, the Ava Lounge and rooftop bar are one of the coolest in this part of Manhattan with a very chill non-scene crowd. Good heat in the rooms and good sized bathrooms. L'Occitane products. If you are looking for a really cool trendy hotel, this is it. Service was great, no issues with front desk staff. I am not a chronic complainer but I do post when something is good and bad. Dream Excellent Experience, 6 Columbus - BAD! My new favorite place to stay when in NYC and the prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to dream at the Dream. A...”
Reviews.Author: Fifeb
Reviews.Content: Don't expect to dream at the Dream. A party in the guest room opposite kept us awake til 4.30am. Doors slamming all night. When security finallly arrived they commented "why is it always this room (212)?". There must have been 20-30 people in the room! They were just asked to quiet things down which they did for about 20 minutes. Although the front desk said they don't allow parties in the rooms - clearly it's not actively discouraged by the night staff. So if you want to party all night in your room with loud music and wake all your neighbors, the Dream is the place to go. If you want to sleep after your fun night out - sleep somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Attitude”
Reviews.Author: delargie
Reviews.Content: We were very excited on arrival as we had heard so much about the Dream thru mags etc. On arrival around 1900hrs after a 22 hrs flight we got out of our Limo with 6 pieces of luggage to find no concierge to greet us so went inside and asked at the reception desk for assistance and was met by a rude young upstart and a gentleman in a concierge uniform who informed me that he would get someone to help us inside,why he wouldnt help is still troubling us. After 10 mins standing in the freezing cold I went inside again and was told someone was coming. We then decided to carry our luggage inside our selves where we were finally met by concierge. We asked for an umbrella on our second day and that was an effort to get one. The lifts are very very slow but this is the case in most older buildings in NY. Overall the front desk staff have an attitude problem which needs to be addressed by management and it certainly soured our visit. The only plus was the nice room and the friendly attitude of the house keeping and restaurant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Dream come true”
Reviews.Author: AshlynW
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved our stay at the Dream hotel, it was so comfortable and it had a great vibe! :]

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep I have ever had in a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ma6907
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, not for the amenities, but for the sleep! We stayed here 3 nights and slept until almost 10 am each day. I don't know how the room was so quiet, dark and comfortable in the worlds busiest city, but it was. As for the other amenities/service at this hotel? I really cant say--we slept the whole time!

Reviews.Title: “Great and funky but not without it's faults!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DeanMadge
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with some really great features. So the plus side - Funky bar in the Penthouse, playing great songs and a free drinks voucher issued by reception on day one! The beds are really comfortable The staff are really nice on the whole In room equipment great, bose equipment with leads from reception for ipods Great quality towels, robes and well stocked mini bar Down sides - Housekeeping standards not great, stain on the head board not cleaned for four days and room was a little dusty Shower not as strong as I would like Some areas of the hotel tired and in need of a refurb I did enjoy the hotel and it was a strong overall visit

Reviews.Title: “anything but a dream...”
Reviews.Author: alpiniMorges
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel because of it's positioning on line and we thought it would be fun. our first bad impression remained as the overall impression. you enter a hall with a reception desk designed to handle very few customers and our staff was certainly not trained. The design concept is certainly interesting but they fail to do the hospitality part. in a nutshell we rented a room for 3 days not more.

Reviews.Title: “a good mid budget offering in a central midtown location”
Reviews.Author: gp199
Reviews.Content: Dream was a pretty good hotel in Midtown. Pros: location, very comfy bed, very clean, friendly staff, good quality bathroom supplies (Occitane) Cons : Room a bit small (but fair size for the money by NYC standard), sad gym. A good solution for the mid range first time traveller to NYC who wants to be in the center of the action. Additional kudos because the hotel agreed to cancel at no charge part of our reservation last minute since we couldn't get there on time because of the bad weather.

Reviews.Title: “Something different in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nickjtan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights and it was great. The room was rather small but cosy, the white with the blue lights in the room made it special, almost like a dream space. The most outstanding part of this hotel was the location. If I didnt forget it was on 56th street which was a the top of all the other attractions, so if you keep walking straight down you'd be able to see everything. Except for central park because its 2 mins away from the hotel on the other direction. I think this hotel location makes it great as it was not noisy but at the same time nearby everything. Oh and 56th street station is immediately on the right of the hotel exit.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice...”
Reviews.Author: MegW84
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just went to NY for a weekend getaway and stayed at Dream. The lobby was trendy but seemed bigger online.. The front desk girls were rude. I've been working in the hospitality industry for over 5 years and they need to work on their customer service! On the other hand, the concierge desk was fabulous! They were so patient and a huge help! Thank you, Dennis and Shawn. The bartendar (I forget the gals name) at Fifty5 (which is attached to Dream) was so nice and very attentive.. The rooms were very clean and the size wasn't bad for NY. Great price for NYC

Reviews.Title: “Living the dream at...The DREAM!”
Reviews.Author: JeanTheDream
Reviews.Content: Can't go wrong, great service, comfortable room...in great location. Rooftop bar is great for cocktails any time of year!

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love Dream”
Reviews.Author: atljs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Dream for 3 nights. I wanted to love it, but I came away just liking it. It won't be a go-to hotel for when I'm in NYC, but I haven't counted it out. Pros: - location: steps from the subway, great breakfast options, Times Square/Broadway shows, Columbus Circle, etc - clean, decent size room (*for NYC*). I've seen some complaints on here regarding the rooms being small... I've stayed in several MUCH smaller NYC hotel rooms. Unfortunately when visiting NYC you have to skew your idea of ideal room size. - loved the apples that were in my room the first night. Cons: - know that if you're staying here, there's a lounge in the building. On Friday and Saturday night my room was vibrating from the bass, and if I wasn't as tired as I was, it would've kept me up. Not a huge thing for me, but I can see where it would bother some. - room service ends at 11pm... I kind of wish it would be an hour or 2 later. Not a dealbreaker for me though. Would I recommend Dream to a friend? Eh, maybe. It won't be an enthusiastic recommendation, but it's still on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,good location”
Reviews.Author: chrism2112
Reviews.Content: Would definately stop here again.Really good location for Times Square area and Central Park.Rooms were not the biggest but beds were large and very comfortable and the soft blue lighting was nice.Very good Italian Resaurant attached to the hotel and nice bar on the top floor.Found the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “you can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: daisia15
Reviews.Content: first timer to the city and fell in love. our hotel is in the center of every staple destination you would want to check out, there are plenty of cabs and the subway is right across the street. in 2 days we were were in the chelsea district, harlem, times square, central park, upper east & west manhattan for the shopping, and there are just tons and tons of little bakeries everywhere. Fluffy's was pretty delicious. some tips before booking: 1. ask for a room above the 7th floor and away from the elevators 2. if you want to store leftovers ask them to empty ur mini bar fridge so it's free of charge 3. use the internet downstairs, it'll cost ya in your room 4. the small rooms are literally a room with a bathroom and a double bed, but very comfortable. it was perfect for my fiance and I. Otherwise, the hotel was great, location could not have been better and the staff was the most friendly than that of most hotels. I'll be staying here next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not a Dream”
Reviews.Author: dm41
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a change from our usual hotel in NY from the website it looked pretty cool......wrong. Our room was not what I would call luxury we were there for one week and were unable to unpack our clothes as the wardrobe space was made fro people less than 4ft, we were unable to even hang up our coats. I am sorry for this price I expect to be able to unpack. The room was not just minimilast but bare, have been in better travel lodges! No offence to Travel Lodge but at this price we could have stayed at the London. We arrived on Halloween and there was a party going on in the bar downstairs that had spilled onto reception that was OK, it was a holiday after all. little did we know this was an omen of the noise we were to expect nightly. We had a small window with a view of a brick wall. The door of the room did not close properly and we had to put something in front of it at night, from the outside it did not look as if it was closed, it had not been hung properly and did not make us feel as though we or our valuables were safe. The lighting in the room was absolutely rubbish it was impossible to put your make up on and there was no full length mirror. It was noisy and the sky bar , I am sorry I live in a city if I want to look into people's living rooms I will go live in a high rise. When we had recovered from our jet lag we checked out early, it was very difficult to get a hotel room and went to the Radisson where the service was much better and the internet was FREE and we saved over $900! The only plus side was the location but this place should be had under the trade descriptions act. I work in partnership with a lot of "boutique" hotels and I am sorry this was not what I was expecting from the description in website or Time Out. If you are young and a clubber and perhaps only use your room to sleep for a few hours and don't want a nice hotel bar and luxury on your holiday then this might suit you. Oh yeah, the ship in the reception, we only spotted it on our last day it is tiny and as far as we could make out the spa was not in the hotel but around the corner. We didn't let it spoil our trip but would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: dadoggda
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, modern, stylish, clean and friendly. The best is the location: from our room we could look down Broadway to Times Square. There is a small wellness area and a cool bar on the top floor with a great view!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool hotel but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: ErikaSthlm
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Central Park. The room was good and big enough. The A/C was noisy but since we stayed there in November it was ok to keep it turned of. We were on the third floor were the noice from the street was a bit disturbing. I'm sure it would have been nicer further up in the building. All in all a nice enough hotel but not a good value.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: CarlisleInsider
Reviews.Content: We had booked online excited at the magic the hotel website promised. We arrived a few hours prior to check- in and the two ladies at the front desk were friendly and prompt. Surprisingly, they didn't turn us away but got us into a room right away. Husband and I were happy to see three working elevators. The lobby is very chic with a constant hub of guests or drivers. Our room was on the 10th floor with a wonderful view of 55th street. We didn't mind that the room was small but the bed could have been more inviting! No kidding I'm 5'3" and my husband is 6'....we both had a difficult time sleeping here. Immediately noticed how HOT the room was. It happened to be 65 degrees in the city this weekend and our room was 86 degrees!!!! No Air Conditioning so Hubby had to prop the bathroom window open. Bathroom had only a shower. After checking in and dropping our luggage, we spent some time shopping only to return to a room that had been "fluffed." They left two bruised rotting apples and a room service menu on our pillows...could they please skip the beat up apples? If you want a place to pass out in after boozing up the club this is your place...for the money we paid we expected better!

Reviews.Title: “Total Rip-Off, Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: city_girl01
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one weekend and the experience was terrible. I couldn't sleep at night because there was so much noise coming from the A/C, the street outside, and the paper thin walls. I woke up on both nights from hearing other guests' fighting in the middle of the night. Says something about the type of people that stay there too. The final blow was check-out time, when they charged me $200 extra on top of my bill for less than 15 min of phone calls i had made to friends in NYC! Apparently they add a $10 connection fee, WHICH IS NOT WRITTEN ANYWHERE. My talk time was only 15 min total: 2 short conversations and then some voicemail messages i left. This is not how to treat customers. Trashy place and poor value for money. I advise you stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Dream Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZoeSC
Reviews.Content: I loved the dream hotel but it wasn't a cozy type of hotel, it was more like a modren hi-tech sorta thing.

Reviews.Title: “Totally satisfied”
Reviews.Author: J_lola_J
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely no complaints regarding my stay at the Dream Hotel. We had a large room with a decent sized bathroom including large shower area, lovely Loccitane products and an extremely comfortable bed that I can only describe as like sleeping on a marshmallow! Reception staff were friendly, the bar was funky and the location just in between Times Square and Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: flyboyMt
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to Times Sq, Central Park, etc. Near a NYC Sightseeing bus stop. Clean and well appointed rooms. Helpful staff and a very good Italian restaurant on site.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and roof bar”
Reviews.Author: dankersoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is placed in the heart of Manhatten with a great bar on the roof, but try and get a room at least 3 floors from the top because it gets noisy at night. Great value for money and very trendy rooms with excellent interior decorations. The young receptionist we encountered was not very helpfull, but the rest of the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for Under 30 Clubbers”
Reviews.Author: lawguyFlorida
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there this past weekend. The positive ends with the location. This hotel has 2 clubs; one on the lobby level and one in the penthouse. Room doors slam all night long with the club set going up and down to the party scene. If you under 30 and in NYC to party, this is the hotel for you. If you plan on sleeping at night the Dream is a Nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GLCM87
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights this month, after reading some negative reviews i was a little worried, but should not have been. On arrival the staff at the front desk were lovey, they upgraded me to a larger room with 2 beds (room 507) which was really nice. The hotel lobby is amazing with a massive tropical fish tank as a centre piece, it really looks totally different from other hotels. The room itself was lovely. The beds were so comfortable it was actually like sleeping on a cloud! The bathroom was great too and complimentary toiletries from L'occitane were a nice touch. Unlike other reviews I have read I heard no noise at all, and had no problems with the lifts either. The lobby can get fairly busy with people waiting for lifts to the bar but it isnt enough to bother you. The concierge was also great, really helpful and very polite, as were all the staff. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay somewhere with some personality and not just another chain hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dream for five nights, having booked through Priceline (@ $100 per night). The room was a decent size, but then I was travelling alone. New York City hotel rooms are small in any case, and this was just fine. It was clean, quiet (my room looked out on rooftops of shops on 7th Avenue) and wonderfully located with the subway on the doorstep, Times Square a 10 minute walk, and Central Park a couple of blocks away. There was also free wireless internet service in the lobby (although not in the room). The only downside was that the lift could be slow at times - but otherwise it was fine. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “My bedroom closet is bigger than the room I had at Dream”
Reviews.Author: negalloc
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the stay at this hip property. Overall worked out fine, with a caveat for room size - my bedroom closet is indeed bigger :)

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected......”
Reviews.Author: mohicans
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughter & I booked 5 nights at Dream through Priceline. After doing so, I became concerned after reading the reviews - especially about bed size. Sharing a double bed may be a little close for comfort unless its a newlywed couple! I requested through email a different room configuration, (2 twins or a queen sized bed) and they would only do so for more cash - which sort of peeved me off. Anyhow, we thought we would tough it out and give it a try. Our first impression of the hotel was the friendly staff, which is always nice after a long day of travelling and delayed flights etc. We were given room 109 - which made me wonder if we were getting the "Priceline Punishment". I had read reviews about the street noise and noise from the main floor night club and wondered if this would be a nightmare. Turns out - we didn't hear a thing - other than a garbage truck one morning. The room was very quiet, however if any staff are reading this - room 109 has a very big running toilet problem - after flushing, it just keeps going....and going.... The beds are very comfortable - and we were tired every day after a long day of sightseeing and walking - so we surprised ourselves by our ability to adapt to the small bed. The rooms are tiny - but we were rarely there, so that didn't matter. We did not ask to have our towels cleaned every day - but they did them anyway. The location is outstanding - out of the crowded, tacky, over priced Times Square area by only a few blocks - very close to Central Park, Columbas Circle and the Carnegie Deli. We ate dinner at the Serafina twice and enjoyed it immensely. Our 5 night experience was positive afterall.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK for couples”
Reviews.Author: kmkm
Reviews.Content: We had booked on Hotwire (which we will never do again), we didn't know we were booking a "boutique" hotel. We were spending 3 nights with our 15 year old daughter and her 15 year old cousin. This is located in a very good, central spot in Manhattan - very convenient. The rooms are very clean, but extremely small, which usually doesn't bother us, but this was ridiculously small. Our room had a view of another wall, no sunlight ever entered the room. The bed was very comfortable, we had a double bed which took up the entire room. There was literally no room to walk around or put your luggage. The lighting was so dim, I felt like I was in a cave or a cell. We needed to use a printer to print boarding passes, and found there was no business center to do so. The concierge was pleasant, but could not accomodate us, as the printers were not working at all, and the technician was working on the problem. I thought this was very odd, for a hotel of this class to not be able to accomodate this request. The lobby is not impressive and the staff was the same. Not rude, but just disinterested and not helpful. The hotel would be fine for a young couple, just looking for a bed to sleep in. Definitely not good for children or teens. Hotwire labeled this as a 3.5 star - I would not rate it that high.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Dreams at the Dream”
Reviews.Author: SophiaRose13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the DREAM hotel in New York for two nights and highly recommend it. It's not always easy to find a decent hotel that isn't overly expensive. Dream is in a good location, it has a friendly staff, the rooms are clean and comfortable, check in and check out were quick, and overall I'd say it's a great value in NYC. I used Hotels.com to make the reservation and went with their small room as I was by myself. It wasn't big but it was clean, comfortable and had everything I needed e.g. iron, ironing board, hair dryer and all the little bottles of shampoo etc. The A/C worked great and I had absolutely no issues and I felt safe. Give it a try, I think you'll be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: pbrien
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical to stay here at first, because of all the mixed reviews. But with a great deal on Priceline I just couldn't say no. The hotel staff was extremely courteous and happy to share their knowledge of the city. The roofdeck and lobby bars were cool, but expensive (it's NYC get used to it). The room was small, but large enough to stay in for a few nights without getting freaked out. Overall this trip was great, and if you want to stay in the perfect location (directly in between Times Square and Central Park) then stay at the Dream. You have my reccomendation.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible hip”
Reviews.Author: Rivercat2
Reviews.Content: We recently held a meeting at the Dream for some clients and they were incredibly easy to deal with. When the cab pulled up and I saw a bunch of hipsters smoking outside, I was a little worried, but all my fears of having to deal with a lot of attitude were unfounded. You can tell this is an older hotel with a recent facelift, but they've focused on comfort and convenience. The bed was amazing, with a fluffy duvet on a pillowtop mattress. Yes, the room was small, but it's New York. The staff is exceedingly friendly and energetic, if a bit green. We loved the 2 story fishtank in the lobby. Warning: don't stay here if you can't tolerate incense. Also, Internet access is wireless only, which caused a problem for one member of our party.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique chich but pricey”
Reviews.Author: LOUBY11
Reviews.Content: Stayed her after a few days work in NY in Dec 08 - great location couple of blocks from Central Park and times square. chich bar - very NY and rooms were cute but VERY small ......................... so if you want a hotel for a base only to see the sights then you could pay a third of hte price and probably get a bigger room but more blocks back in manhattan. ideal for sight seeing. reception efficient and polite, very clean nice big red rosey apples on your pillow and fab french tioletries, but the bathroom ... no bath just shower/sink/loo no bigger than my home downstairs loo bar upstairs played good music with dj - pricey drinks cira us$10 per jd and coke ...................... and lots of freaky dancers! but good atmosphere ................... recommend if you can afford £300 per night and you liek a bit of ambience ............... and somethign a bit different ............. as I say ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, No Problems”
Reviews.Author: JadeDogwood
Reviews.Content: Front Dest allowed me to check in early. I really appreciated that, as I wanted to rest up befora a function at Lincoln Center, which is walking distance. Had fun at Italian restaurant on first floor. Met nice locals who gave me advice about getting around, and where to go. The club on the top floor was not a good place for singles. Music was very loud, and no way to strike up a conversation. Carnagie Deli around the corner. This was my first stay over in NYC, so can't compare to other hotels. I imagine most rooms are small. More important to be clean, and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: pcastillo
Reviews.Content: First time I've stayed here. And I'm always a little leary of the cool NYC hotel. The elevators are small and old. Considering that I would suggest staying on the 1st floor ---- although its really the 2nd floor. Why? So that after you've taken luggage up, you can use the stairs and bypass the elevators until check out. Beds are incredible. Bathroom nice and livable. Not big by any means, but no complaints here. 42" plasma on the wall, adequate space around one side of the bed. Didn't eat here --- but then its NYC, why would I? Blue neon affect lighting and a 65 degree temperature room greeted me. NICE. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed I've ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: For2009
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend trip to NY. I was traveling with my son and his girlfriend. We booked our room on priceline and was quite suprised at the room we got. The Dream hotel is in a perfect location. We were able to convienantly travel around the city from here. We were given a room on the 10th floor with 2 double beds. It was a large room by NY standards. The bedding was white and the softest I've ever slept in. The room was emaculant. I don't think I've ever stayed in a cleaner hotel room. We all slept very well. The room was so quiet that it was hard to believe you were in the city that never sleeps. The staff was excellent and very accomidating I will absolutely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here... your room could be a closet!”
Reviews.Author: TamarannCA
Reviews.Content: Stayed two miserable nights at the Dream.... Our room HAD to be the smallest in the hotel -- literally 20" of walking room around the bed (we measured). We asked to be moved to something at least a little larger, and they would only accommodate us with a 90 dollar a night additional charge. Room doors don't block out any noise. We heard every word and every step (even flip flops flapping) of anyone in the hallway within 10 rooms of ours. There's a nightclub on the ground floor, so folks were going to their rooms at 3 and 4 AM, and we knew it! (Not to mention the boom boom noise emanating from the floor below.) Don't believe the photos. The lobby is fine, and so is the location, but the room we got was absolutely unacceptable. The fitness center was not open during posted open hours. Room Service is from nearby hotel and has limited very expensive choices (even for NYC).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, funky hotel, staff not so good”
Reviews.Author: 1983Sarah
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Dream Hotel for a birthday trip about 18 months ago. The hotel is a few blocks from Times Square so a good location, and just far enough off to not be too noisy and busy. The room was of an adequate size and clean, smart design with crisp whites and silver furniture. Turndown service included a weather report and fruit which was a nice touch, and the toiletries in the bathroom were of a good quality. VERY COMFY BED!! There was strange lighting which took us a while to work out how to turn off, it was blue! Also the bath was not full size which was a bit frustrating if you wanted to have a relax after a long day in the city. The hotel is funky, with a pretty exclusive bar on the rooftop, and a smart restaurant on the ground floor. We didn't use either during our stay. The main downside is the service. My boyfriend had ordered a bottle of champagne as a surprise for our birthday the following day - the surprise was ruined as when we arrived it was already there, not even chilled. We had it on our birthday and asked for an ice bucket - twice - what we got was one of their plastic bedroom bins with ice in. Then we realised when drinking that the bottle was actually sparkling wine. When we enquired we were told "that's what champagne is in the States" I don't think so!! They billed us for champagne and it was a real struggle to sort it out before we left. But a decent hotel with an interesting atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Really Noise”
Reviews.Author: FDXmiguel
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel for 8 days... The room is really small, and the bathroom is really really old e poor. I stay in the 3Th Floor, and the noise is unbearable... there was a big AC machine close to the windows. Is you stay there make sure you are above 7th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy”
Reviews.Author: Honeysuckle
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC for a show, romantic weekend and to celebrate our birthdays. At check in we were upgraded to a suite. Two bathrooms, large bedroom and "living room". Corner room with great views. Bed was wonderful ! Apples on our pillows were a nice touch in the Big Apple! Blue lights were fun and different. The aquarium in the lobby was amazing! Enjoyed the rooftop bar very much. Yana was a great little waitress and Heather, events manager, was very nice. Who would have thought you could get a $2 hamburger or hot dog in NYC at a roof top bar??? Or have comped drinks??? Featured drink made with cucumber & TyKu was very refreshing and light for a warm afternoon before going to dinner & show. We stayed on the 8th floor and the bar was quite busy Saturday night as evidenced by the line for the elevators (one reserved for hotel guests only so this was not a problem) and noise was not an issue. Location was very good, Central Park, restaurants, theater all close by - short walk or short taxi ride. Front desk and bellman very helpful and friendly. All in all a wonderful place to stay in the city and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: tami01
Reviews.Content: Based on the rather mixed reviews on Tripadvisor and other forums I have been quite sceptical about this hotel, but as we made a good deal through our travel agent, we hoped for the best - and find it better than expected. Lucky us, we get a "larger" room in the 9th floor on the backside of the hotel which means no street noise and no sound from the bar and the rooftop, which is a good place with a nice view in the evening. Comfortable queen bed, solid bathroom, space to store our luggage (incl. a wheelchair), good flatscreen and Bose radio - nothing to complain about. The blue lighting of the room - well...if you liked Miami Vice 20 years ago, you might find this enjoyable. Friendly and quick responding doormen and reception crew (had a little issue with the safe which took only 10 min between first call and problem solving). In addition, they warned us about the sensible sensor of the minibar which might lead to charges even without taking anything - nice move. Onsite Italian restaurant Serafina is ok-ish. Downsides? Not that many - except the wireless fee, which is ridiculous these days when you get access anywhere else for free. If you like Central Park, Columbus Circle and the uptown museums like the NAD, this place is to be recommend if you get a good deal. If not, check for some of the standard tourist hotels in midtown which are a better bargain.

Reviews.Title: “This Dream can turn into a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: R&DAshland
Reviews.Content: This is a very trendy hotel with serious flaws. First of all, the staff treats you like you are bothering them. When we checked in we were told we had the best room in the hotel (we are i-prefer members). They forgot to tell us that the room was right below the night club, which is on the top floor of the hotel. The bass boomed so loudly in our room until 1-2 AM every single night that we couldn't sleep. One night one of the hotel managers reluctantly called up to the club and they agreed to turn the bass down (but that was after I made 3 calls to the front desk). The next night another manager crossly told me "the club is a separate business, I can't do anything. You should have changed your room (we had one of the bigger rooms in the hotel and we were not about to go into one of the closet sized rooms that seem to populate most of the hotel).” I told her that if they wanted to pack up our things and move us we would, and she just blew me off. No "I'm sorry," no apology, no nothing. That was the overall attitude of everyone in the hotel (except for one front desk person) any time we asked for anything, even to be connected to room service (they connected us to their restaurant instead). They constantly brought the wrong newspaper, they forgot to clean our room one day, the lighted mirror in the bathroom didn't light, and the door to the terrace we had wouldn't lock. Even a maid acted angry toward us because we weren't out of the room for her to clean by 11 AM one day during our stay. The phrases "customer service" and "service with a smile" are mostly unknown here. if you're young, hip, bring earplugs, and like dealing with rude people you'll love this hotel. If you're a seasoned traveler who has experienced really good hotels and service you might want to stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: PortugalElsa
Reviews.Content: This trip was a birthday present for my husband , and it was a dream for me , this hotel is a dream come true , the room is amazing , service amazing , staff excellent... i must thank all the staff for helping on the surprise i made for my husband ... i defenatly recommendthis hotel to a friend or famaly , actualy i already did it...

Reviews.Title: “Cool place, good location”
Reviews.Author: melachocolat
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is quite good: you are very close to Central Park and Columbus Circus, right next to a subway station with fast trains to Down Town and Time Square is not far either for the newest shows in town. Staff is young and friendly. The room service quite different, they focus on Pizza, which is a nice change and it probably reflects the fact that rather young people would stay in this hotel. The lobby reminds almost of a night club, with an aquarium right in the middle. The whole hotel is quite dark too. There are 2 bars, perfect for "a last one" before going to bed. The rooms are rather small, but comfortable - and after all, you are not in New York to spend much time in your hotel room. The room rates for ok too, so good value for money here!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: TravellerLA
Reviews.Content: I just don't understand the other reviews on this place. I've stayed in hotels in NYC for 20 years, easily over a dozen different places, and I can't remember one this bad. The hotel employees were not especially the issue; some were great and others obviously had no direction or initiative. It was the building and it was mainly form over function. The A/C units in each room, and I had five rooms, were all individual units and were entirely enclosed within each room--they were loud. We all opened our windows and had to turn off the A/C. Luckily the evenings were cool. And there was no full length mirror in any room. Furthermore, for families please be forwarnd that there is erotic art on the walls and statues in the hallways. It's by no means obscene, however, it's specific and from what I could see is advertising this hotel as a sex hotel for couples and very short stays. We were all there for four nights and the price was right with priceline, however, I would never chose this on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Dreamy”
Reviews.Author: nico35
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful, sexy hotel! From the minute you walk in you know you are some place special. The staff is over the top friendly and helpful. The rooms are amazing, we had a suite and it was huge by Manhattan standards. The ethereal glow of the place made for very sweet dreams. I highly recommend this hotel for a special time in NY. If you are looking for something unique, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain in the right location with a great staff and a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rcullet
Reviews.Content: The Dream Hotel is on the corner of 55th and Broadway. It has a restaurant with street side dinning on Broadway. The address is 210 West 55th. From here you are a short walk to 5th Avenue shopping or Time Square madness. There is a bar on the 14th floor as well as rooftop deck with a great view that gets pretty lively and a club like lounge off the lobby that heats up late. Beer at any of the three was $8. Every staff member I encountered was friendly, helpful and sincere. The hotel is well kept, clean, modern and everything worked. I had the smallest room available. There was a large LCD TV and a built-in desk. WiFi is $10 per day and worked reliably. This is a well renovated older building and as such the rooms are small. The bathrooms are very small. If you are looking for a large room and spacious bath look elsewhere. I thought the rate was very fair for a hotel of this caliber in this location. I stayed during a holiday weekend. The rate for Friday was $229 plus tax and Saturday was $259. The spa was great. I had a very good Ayurvedic massage.

Reviews.Title: “Small (SMALL) rooms and lots of NOISE!”
Reviews.Author: blubs99
Reviews.Content: Pretty hotel in nice location, but rooms are very small and the windows do not keep the noise out of the rooms. I stayed in 2 rooms, first room on 5th floor had LOUD turbine noise from the AC system on the ground floor. They moved me to the "quiet" side on the 4th floor but I still heard the turbine plus new noises from the ground floor and the bar on the 14th floor. I don't mind small rooms in NY as I work in NY about 15 times a year, but these rooms are smaller than most other hotels, you can barely walk around the bed. One positive is Serafina restaurant off lobby. Excellent breakfast (not cheap but outstanding) and maybe the best pizza outside Naples.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dream!”
Reviews.Author: jojo808
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at The Dream hotel. I got a fantastic deal through price-line ($120/night) but was worried about the negative reviews. Here are some random observations and thoughts. I arrived in NY at 11 am and called to see if I could check in early. They said they were full but I could drop off my luggage and pre-register. I didn't end up doing that but got there at 2:30 and was able to check in then. I had leis shipped for a graduation I was attending and they were delivered before I arrived. I asked if there was a refrigerator I could use overnight. The woman at the desk said there was a minibar in the room, and that they could empty that for me so I could have room for the leis. I thought that was great. The room was very small. It was fine for just me but If my husband were with me, it would have been too small. The bed was a full size, there was a dresser with two drawers and a small refrigerator, a closet (with iron and ironing board), and a small desk with an outlet on top! Loved that convenience. The bathroom was also small (maybe tiny!) with a half tub. The TV is a flat screen mounted to the wall. There was about 24 inches between the end of the bed and the wall. I peeked in a few other rooms in passing and I'm pretty confident mine was the smallest. The bed is tall enough that I was able to slide my suitcase under it to save space. There was no view, just a building. There was a privacy blind that did bring in some natural light. I think the lighting was a bit dark. The bathroom had a magnified mirror but still, the light wasn't very good. The bed was heaven. That alone will make be go back! It had a feather top pad and fluffy pillows with a soft comforter. Loved it!! Service was outstanding! I forgot toothpaste and they brought some up right away. I started my period early and wasn't prepared. I called down and supplies were delivered. I wanted a glass of wine and the two bars were super crowded and LOUD and a gentleman at the desk got a glass for me and I was able to drink it in the lobby while talking on the phone. The housekeepers were very nice. I'm not sure if it was because I was expecting rudeness, but the service was just superb. Plus they emptied the minibar. The hotel is very trendy and has a few popular clubs but even though I am pushing 50, It wasn't obnoxious. This hotel would be perfect for young people who party! The location was fantastic. Wireless internet is about $10/day. Next time I visit NYC I hoe to take my children so I don't think I would stay here unless they have suites but If I happen to visit again, I would stay here. The bed was a dream!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: azlodaro
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel located close to Times Square. The location was fantastic as it is very close to most of the tourist attractions. We checked in on Saturday May 1st. The hotel lobby is very cool and trendy looking with a large fish tank in the center. We were on the first floor and had a double bed room. The room was small but had a cool trendy feel with blue lights under the bed, in the desk. The furniture is mostly white and showed wear and tear. Trying to figure out how the light switches worked was an ordeal. The main switch turns off the blue light in the desk...while other swtiches are used to turn of the main room lights. The room was too hot and we turned down the thermostat to cool down the room and left for dinner, upon our return, the temperature had not changed. We called down and was told someone would be up, 1 hour later we had to call again. The technician finally arrived and played with the switch and finally got the AC to work. On our second night, we moved to a King Suite and experienced the same issues with light switches. However, this room was too cold and we called to have the heating fixed. The technician arrived and told us that the hotel had turned off the heating option and all we would get is cold air and suggested we ask for additional blankets to keep us warm. Checkout time was 12noon and we called to ask for a later checkout of 1:30pm and was told the hotel was sold out. We left our room at 12noon and forgot to check out and went out to have lunch. When we came back to collect our luggage an hour later, we apologized for forgetting to check out and was told it was not a problem, this did not make sense since we were told no when we asked for an extension. The hotel staff did just did not care. I would not recommend this hotel. We stayed at the Grand Hyatt in NYC and I would recommend you check that one out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sullific
Reviews.Content: It's blue, it's neon, it's trendy - just pricey! Room was small but that's New York...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, lovely, modern hotel... had a perfect stay at the dream hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: missladyloulou
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked 5 nights in new york at the Dream hotel as a surprise christmas pressie for me! We went over easter from 11th arpil-17th april. At first i was a little worried with all the negitive reviews i had read, however i couldn't be more happy with my stay at the dream hotel! When we arrived hotel staff were very welcoming, gave us free drinks vouchers for bar next door, and checked us in quickly. our room was the 12th floor and happened to be a corner room which was very spacious with lots of floor space! (prob because it was a corner room though) so we were very happy with this as i know new york hotel rooms are said to be on the small side. Lovely modern crisp feel to the room, very clean and simple, and to our taste. bathroom again decent size, lovely and clean, shampoo and conditioner products for us to use and towels changed everyday. large plasma tv on the wall and plenty of storage space for clothes and fluff bathrobes! not great view from the room but we were more interested in going out to see new york anyway! Great location, starbucks across the road, close to central park, 5th avanue, times square!! also lots of small eating places near by for breakfast and lunch! Subway at the corner of the block, which we used to get to places a little further away! defo the best way to get around, taxi's are too expensive!! Overall FAB stay at the dream hotel, no negitive comments or any problems in the 5 nights we spent here, and we will defo be going back and would recommend this hotel to all my family and friends!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Freindly Staff”
Reviews.Author: lembke7
Reviews.Content: I'm suprised by the nagative comments regarding the staff at the Dream Hotel. They couldn't have been nicer to my girllfriend and I. We arrived at 6:30 am on a Saturday and inquired about dropping off our bags, so we could walk around Central Park. The staff let us know that are room was already ready for check in. She also gave us drink tickets for the bar next door. Very good location. Two blocks to the park, and right at the Northern edge of the Theatre District.
